Actions.action_deck: return true if the button calling this action is on the specified deck: 'action_deck 1 ? actionA : actionB'
Actions.add_favoritefolder: make the selected folder a favorite folder (monitored folders).
Actions.add_to_list: Add the currently selected songs in the browser to the specified List. 'add_to_list "my_list"'
Actions.adjust_cbg: adjust the beat grid. 'adjust_cbg +2' moves the start bar from 4:4. 'adjust_cbg +10%' moves the actual bars.
Actions.assign_controller: Assign a specific controller to this deck. 'deck 1 assign_controller "CDJ400" 2' assigns the second CDJ400 to deck 1 Or in a controller mapping 'deck 1 assign_controller' will assign the controller the action was executed from to deck 1.
Actions.assign_related_controller: Assign the controller related to this controller to the deck, but leave this controller untouched (related has 1 layer, main has 4)
Actions.auto_bpm_transition: When pressed, the bpm of the song is gradually moved to the bpm of the other deck while keeping both songs at the same bpm When smartPlay or autoBPMMatch are on, it will move to the bpm of the other deck at normal speed When using parameter 'source_original', 'target_original' or 'target_current' you can force which bpm it will transition to
Actions.auto_bpm_transition_options: Enable/Disable certain features of the auto_bpm_transition. First parameter can be 'length', 'loop', 'stems', 'master_tempo', 'autostart' When selecting stems to disable, use 'auto_bpm_transition_options stems vocal' for example
Actions.auto_crossfade: Automatically crossfade to the other deck. You can specify the duration of the crossfade in ms: 'auto_crossfade 2000ms' Assigned to a slider, or specifying a specific position, it will move the crossfader slowly to that position: 'auto_crossfade 50%' or 'auto_crossfade 1000ms 50%'
Actions.auto_match_bpm: when Auto Match BPM is on, songs are automatically set to the same BPM when loaded
Actions.auto_match_key: when Auto Match KEY is on, songs are automatically set to a compatible KEY when loaded, if possible
Actions.auto_pitch_lock: when Auto Pitch Lock is on, pitch_lock engages whenever BPMs are matched, so that moving manually one pitch slider will move the other in order to keep the match
Actions.auto_sync_options: show a context menu to control the various auto-sync options
Actions.auto_sync_settings: Set some pre-defined values for the main automatic sync settings (auto match bpm, auto match key, auto sync, auto pitch lock) depending on the skin category
Actions.automix: Start or stop automatic playlist mixing
Actions.automix_add_next: Add the songs selected in the browser to the automix playlist right after the song currently playing If a song in the automix list is selected and automix is active, move it after the currently playing song
Actions.automix_dualdeck: Enable or disable automix using both decks
Actions.automix_editor: Open the automix editor, and fine-tune the automix transitions for every songs in your playlist
Actions.automix_editor_movetrack: When the automix editor is opened, move the selected track's position automix_editor_movetrack 'current' +10 Also accepts 'next' or 'previous' to move the next or previous track. When the number is not given it can be mapped to rotary knobs or jog wheels
Actions.automix_skip: When automix is active, skip the current song and mix to the next one
Actions.backspin: Do a backspin. It is possible to specify the length: 'backspin 5000ms' or 'backspin 4bt'
Actions.beat_juggle: Alternatively jumps one beat forward and backward 'beat_juggle 0.5' will jump 1/2 beat forward or backward
Actions.beat_tap: tap on a few beats to set a new bpm for the song if the application didn't got it right on the first time.
Actions.beatjump: Jump a certain number of beats as set by beatjump_select 'beatjump +1' to jump forward, or 'beatjump -1' to jump backwards
Actions.beatjump_pad: execute 'goto +x' where x depends on the pad number and the beatjump_page
Actions.beatjump_page: change the offset of the jumps in beatjump_pad actions
Actions.beatjump_select: Select the number of beats the beatjump action will jump 'beatjump_select 4' to set beatjump to 4 beats 'beatjump_select +1' to set the next higher beat size 'beatjump_select 50%' to halve the current beat size 'beatjump_select 200%' to double the current beat size
Actions.beatlock: When beatlock is activated, the songs are kept synchronized, even when moving the pitch, scratching, etc...
Actions.blink: turn on and off the LED, once per second. You can specify the speed: 'blink 1000ms' Speed can also be specified in number of beats: 'blink 1bt'. The time blinking can also be specified: 'blink 1bt 25%'
Actions.blink_play: blinking fast when less than 10 seconds remaining, blinking slow when less than 30 seconds remaining, off otherwise 'blink_play on' is similar, but is on when the song is paused, and only off if no song is loaded or the loaded song has an error
Actions.brakespeed: vinyl brake speed, the larger, the longer it takes for the record to get from playing to stopped
Actions.broadcast: start or stop to broadcast Optionally add parameter to specify "video", "direct", "server" or "podcast". Without parameters it will use the last used mode.
Actions.broadcast_message: set or get the broadcast message.
Actions.browsed_file_analyze: reanalyze the current file selected in the browser use 'browsed_file_analyze multi' to do a scan for multiple bpms
Actions.browsed_file_color: set the color of the file currently selected in the browser. Example: browsed_file_color "red" Use browsed_file_color "reset" to clear the color and set the color back to default
Actions.browsed_file_info: open the Tag Editor for the browsed song.
Actions.browsed_file_prepare_stems: prepare stems for the file(s) currently selected in the browser
Actions.browsed_file_reload_tag: Reload tag of file currently selected in browser. This will overwrite changes made in the VirtualDJ database by what is saved in the file's tag.
Actions.browsed_file_rename: rename the current file selected in the browser
Actions.browsed_file_reveal: open the OS file manager to the browsed song
Actions.browsed_song: set a property of the currently browsed file: "browsed_song 'rating' 5", ...
Actions.browsed_song_hashtag: add or remove a hash tag from user1, user2 or comment of the currently browsed file: "browsed_song_hashtag 'user 1' '#high_energy'"
Actions.browser_enter: if focus is on songs, load the selected song. if focus is on folders, change focus to songs.
Actions.browser_export: Export the current list of files to a CSV or HTML file
Actions.browser_folder: if focus is on songs, change focus to folders. if focus is on folders, open or close the subfolders of the selected folder.
Actions.browser_geniusdj: Lookup recommendations based on the items currently selected in the browser Use 'browser_geniusdj playing' to use the currently playing track instead of the track selected in the browser
Actions.browser_gotofolder: 'browser_gotofolder' goes to the folder containing the current file. 'browser_gotofolder "/my_path/my_folder"' goes to the specified folder. 'browser_gotofolder 4' goes to the fourth virtual/favorite folder.
Actions.browser_isactive: return true when the browser was used by a controller in the past 6 seconds
Actions.browser_move: browser_move +1 : Moves the currently selected song in a playlist down browser_move 'top' or browser_move 'bottom' : Moves the selected song to the top or the bottom of the list
Actions.browser_open_folder: Expand selected folder in browser when closed, or close folder when opened. You can also use 'browser_open_folder off' to always close the folder, or 'browser_open_folder on' to open a folder
Actions.browser_options: show the context menu about the browser filters, root folders, database, etc
Actions.browser_padding: Change the padding around lines in folder and list views. Example: browser_padding 50%
Actions.browser_remove: Remove the selected song from playlist
Actions.browser_scroll: scroll through the songs or folders. 'browser_scroll +1' or 'browser_scroll -1' to scroll one line, or "browser_scroll 'top'", "browser_scroll 'bottom'" to scroll to the beginning or end
Actions.browser_shortcut: 'browser_shortcut': assign the current folder as a new shortcut\n'browser_shortcut X': go to the folder assigned to the Xth shortcut
Actions.browser_sort: Sort the browser files on the specified column: 'browser_sort "artist"', 'browser_sort "lastplay"',... To sort in descending order, add a - in front of the column name: 'browser_sort "-bpm"' To explicitly sort in ascending order, add a + in front of the column name: 'browser_sort "+bpm"' To reset the sort order of a playlist to it's original order, use 'browser_sort "Original Sort Order"'
Actions.browser_window: Change the active browser zone. "browser_window 'folders'", "browser_window 'songs'", "browser_window 'sideview'", or "browser_window 'automix'", "browser_window 'sidelist'", "browser_window 'sampler'" Cycle through available browser zones. "browser_window +1", "browser_window -1" Cycle through specified zones. Example "browser_window 'folders,songs'"
Actions.can_sandbox: returns true if virtualdj can be sandboxed. sandbox cannot be activated while you have effects or samples active, or video, or if you're scratching, or if you have more than one deck playing with the volume up.
Actions.clone_deck: clone the deck (load the same song on the other deck, and play it from the same position, ready for beat-juggling).
Actions.clone_from_deck: clone from the other deck (load the song from the other deck, and play it from the same position, ready for beat-juggling).
Actions.color: color "red" color "#C08040" color 0.8 0.5 0.25 color 75% "red" (returns a dimmed red) color 0.66 (returns a gray)
Actions.color_mix: Mix two colors based on an action in the third parameter color_mix white red `get_limiter`
Actions.colorfx_prefader: color fx are prefader (required for some controllers)
Actions.constant: Return the specified value Example: 'get constant 75%' always returns 75%
Actions.controller_mapping: Assign a mapping to a controller 'controller_mapping "My Mapping"' assigns the mapping 'My Mapping' to the controller the command was executed on 'controller_mapping "CDJ400" "My Mapping"' assigns the mapping 'My Mapping' to all CDJ400s 'controller_mapping "CDJ400" "My Mapping" 2' assigns the mapping 'My Mapping' to the second CDJ400
Actions.controllervar: variable that is unique to each controller. You can add # in front of the variable name to make it both deck and controller-dependent
Actions.countdown: Count down to a specific date or time. Example: countdown '2025/01/01 00:00' Second parameter can be used to optionally format the return value. Use %full, %HH, %MM, %SS, %DD
Actions.crash: you could always use this action if you're feeling bored or depressed
Actions.create_list_from_playlist: Save the automix list in MyLists
Actions.cross_assign: assign this deck to a side of the crossfader: "deck 3 cross_assign 'left'" or "deck 3 cross_assign 'thru'"
Actions.crossfader: move the crossfader. crossfader 0% will only let the left deck out, crossfader 100% will only let the right deck out.
Actions.crossfader_curve: select the curve of the crossfader. enter a value to adjust the slope from a X curve (0%) to a inverted-U curve (100%). you can also specify common curves by name ("smooth", "full", "scratch", "cut"). or you can draw your own curve, using a syntax like 'crossfader_curve "0=[1,0]/0.5=[1,1]/1=[0,1]"'.
Actions.cue: if playing, go to the last cue point and continue playing. if paused, set the current position as cue point, and preview the cue as long as pressed. if in loop, change loop_in to the cue point but keep the loop's length. you can specify a number ('cue 1', 'cue 57') to work with several cues.
Actions.cue_button: act like cue_stop, cue_play or cue_cup depending on the cueMode setting
Actions.cue_color: query or set the color of a cue point Query example: cue_color 1 Set example: cue_color 1 'yellow'
Actions.cue_countdown: count down to the next cue (or end) in beats use 'cue_countdown color' or 'cue_countdown name' to get the name or color of the next cue point
Actions.cue_counter: count up or down to the nearest cue point in beats use 'cue_counter color' or 'cue_counter name' to get the name or color of the nearest cue point
Actions.cue_countup: count up from the last cue point (or start) in beats use 'cue_countup color' or 'cue_countup name' to get the name or color of the last cue point
Actions.cue_cup: if playing, rewind to the last cue point, and start again on release. if paused, set the current position as cue point.
Actions.cue_display: Show information about a cue point based on the cueDisplay config option. Example: 'cue_display 1' Can also be used to modify the cueDisplay option by using +1 or -1 as parameter: 'cue_display +1' The cueDisplay option can also be set by name: 'cue_display name'
Actions.cue_loop: Jump to a cue and stay in a loop. Use cue_loop_hold to select if loop is temporary, or stays until pressed again. When the cueLoopAutoSync option is enabled, jumping to the cue is beat synchronized
Actions.cue_loop_hold: Toggle cue_loop between looping while pressed and turn loop on/off
Actions.cue_name: "cue_name 1" returns the name of cue point #1, or changes the cue point when pressed
Actions.cue_play: if playing, pause and go to the last cue point. if paused, set the current position as cue point, and preview the cue as long as pressed. if you kept pressed more than 2s (or the time specified), it will continue playing once you release. syntax: 'cue_play 1 1000ms'
Actions.cue_pos: "cue_pos 1" returns the position of cue point #1 as a percentage "cue_pos 1 msec", "cue_pos 1 sec", "cue_pos 1 min" returns the position of cue point #1, msec, sec and min parts "cue_pos 1 mseconly" returns the position of cue point #1 in milliseconds "cue_pos 1 beats" returns the position of the cue point in number of beats from first beat
Actions.cue_select: Select the nth cue point as default cue point for cue, hotcue, etc.. actions. Does not change position to the selected cue point.
Actions.cue_stop: if playing, pause and go to the last cue point. if paused, set the current position as cue point, and preview the cue as long as pressed. you can specify a number ('cue_stop 1', 'cue_stop 57') to work with several cues.
Actions.custom_button: a custom button is a button with initially no action, but the action can be written in VDJScript by the user
Actions.custom_button_edit: open the custom button editor to set or change the action
Actions.custom_button_name: return (or set) the name for this custom button
Actions.cycle: syntax: 'cycle "my_var" 42'. increment my_var, and goes back to 0 when it reaches 42. 'cycle "my_var" -42' decrements my_var, and goes to 41 after it reached 0.
Actions.debug: display the value of the parameter (you can use this to see what values controllers are sending, for example)
Actions.deck_options: show a context menu to select the behavior of the play and cue buttons, the various smart modes, and pitch options
Actions.delete_cue: Deletes a stored cue point. If no cue number is specified, it will delete the currently active cue point
Actions.device_side: Assign a different action for a button or slider of a device depending on which side of the device it is on: "device_side 'left' ? action_for_left : action_for_right" For more than 2-deck controllers, you can use "device_side 1 ? action1 : device_side 2 ? action2 ? device_side 3 ? action3 : etc..."
Actions.display_time: set the mode to display time: "total", "remain", "elapsed", +1 or -1.
Actions.doubleclick: execute different actions depending if the key is pressed twice in a short period of time or not: 'doubleclick ? automix : mix_now'. you can specify the time between two presses ('doubleclick 1000ms'), by default it's 300ms.
Actions.down: execute different actions depending if the key if pressed or released: 'down ? action1 : action2'
Actions.dualdeckmode: toggle dual deck mode. when enabled dualdeckmode_decks will apply to both decks 1/3 or 2/4
Actions.dump: reverse the playback direction while dump is active, then when deactivated, start again forward from where the song should have been if it had been playing forward during the dump. when quantize_all is active, dump will be quantized to match the beats. This can also be forced by using 'dump quantized' or 'dump notquantized' to dump only while the key is pressed, use 'dump while_pressed'
Actions.edit_bpm: open the BPM Editor to edit the bpm and beat grid
Actions.edit_comment: open a window to edit the comment on the selected track.
Actions.edit_poi: open the POI Editor to edit the cue points, and other points of interest
Actions.edit_search: put the keyboard focus in the search zone but keep the actual search string.
Actions.edit_singer: Pops up the dialog to change the singer of the currently selected song in the karaoke list
Actions.effect_3slots_layout: Change between the 1-slot and 3-slots layout for effects
Actions.effect_active: activate/deactivate the effect on a specific slot. example: effect_active 1 'flanger' on or effect_active 1
Actions.effect_arm_active: Activate the effect selected using effect_arm_select on the deck selected using effect_arm_deck
Actions.effect_arm_beats: Change the speed of the effect selected using effect_arm_select on the deck selected using effect_arm_deck
Actions.effect_arm_bpm: Get the bpm of the deck selected using effect_arm_deck
Actions.effect_arm_deck: For controllers with a deck selection switch for effects, select the deck effects will be activated on using effect_arm_active Use 'effect_arm_deck single' to allow only one deck at a time to be armed Use 'effect_arm_deck master' to select master instead of a deck. 'sampler', 'mic', and 'aux' also supported
Actions.effect_arm_select: For controllers with a effect selection switch, select the effect that will be activated using effect_arm_active
Actions.effect_arm_slider: Move the effect parameter of the effect selected using effect_arm_select on the deck selected using effect_arm_deck Use "effect_arm_slider 1 2" to move the second slider of the first slot
Actions.effect_arm_slider_label: Get the effect parameter label of the effect selected using effect_arm_select on the deck selected using effect_arm_deck. Use 'effect_arm_slider_label 1 short' to get the short label
Actions.effect_arm_slider_name: Get the effect parameter name of the effect selected using effect_arm_select on the deck selected using effect_arm_deck. Use 'effect_arm_slider_name 1 short' to get the short label
Actions.effect_arm_slider_text: Get the effect parameter text of the effect selected using effect_arm_select on the deck selected using effect_arm_deck.
Actions.effect_arm_slot: Toggle if a slot will be activated by using effect_arm_active
Actions.effect_arm_stem: Select/unselect a stem to be used with "stems" as slot for effect_ actions Accepted stem names are Vocal, HiHat, Bass, Instru, Kick. They can be combined using "+"
Actions.effect_bank_load: load the effects in deck fx slots 1 to 6 from the bank specified by the parameter
Actions.effect_bank_save: save the effects in deck fx slots 1 to 6 to the bank specified by the parameter
Actions.effect_beats: set the beat parameter for certain effects
Actions.effect_beats_all: set the beat parameter for 1, 3 or 6 slots depending on skin6FxLayout and skin3FxLayout settings
Actions.effect_bpm_deck: set/get a custom bpm for plugins activated on this deck. Use 'effect_bpm_deck off' to reset and use the bpm of the song or 'effect_bpm_deck 120' to set it to 120 bpm
Actions.effect_bpm_deck_tap: tap a custom bpm for plugins activated on this deck. Use 'effect_bpm_deck off' to reset and use the bpm of the song
Actions.effect_button: 'effect_button 1 2' button 2 on slot 1 'effect_button 2' button 2 on slot 1
Actions.effect_clone: Load into this deck all 3 slots from the current left or right deck
Actions.effect_colorfx: 'effect_colorfx 1 "echo"' to use echo on custom color fx slot 1 (up to 4 custom slots available)
Actions.effect_colorslider: Control the effect from center position off, to full on either left or right
Actions.effect_command: send a command to this effect
Actions.effect_disable_all: 'deck 1 effect_disable_all' Disables all effects on deck 1 'deck master effect_disable_all' Disables all master effects 'effect_disable_all sampler' Disables all sampler effects. 'aux' or 'mic' can be used for mic or aux effects
Actions.effect_fxsendreturndeck_multi: Select which source to apply fx to for a specific send/return channel in case there are more than one 'deck 1 effect_fxsendreturndeck_multi master' : Apply master fx on the first fx send/return pair 'deck 2 effect_fxsendreturndeck_multi mic' : Apply mic fx on the second fx send/return pair 'deck 2 effect_fxsendreturndeck_multi 4' : Apply deck 4 fx on the second fx send/return pair
Actions.effect_has_button: 'effect_has_slider 1 2 on' -> returns true if there is a second button on slot 1
Actions.effect_has_slider: effect_has_slider 1 2 on -> returns true if there is a second slider on slot 1 effect_has_slider 1 -> returns true if there is a first slider on slot 0
Actions.effect_mixfx: Associate an effect with the crossfader
Actions.effect_mixfx_activate: Toggle mix fx on or off. Use effect_mixfx_select to select
Actions.effect_mixfx_select: Select the mix fx when moving the crossfader
Actions.effect_releaseslider: Control the effect release specific slider
Actions.effect_releaseslider_active: Control the effect release specific slider and auto activate the effect
Actions.effect_select: effect_select 2 "echo" -> select effect echo in slot 2 effect_select 1 -1 -> select previous effect in slot 1 effect_select +1 -> select next effect in slot 1 effect_select -> show popup window for slot 1 effect_select 1 -> show popup window for slot 1 effect_select 1 0.2 -> select the 2/10th effect from the list in slot 1 effect_select "audioonlyvisualisation" -> select visualisation used when song has no video effect_select deactivates the previous plugin in the specified slot
Actions.effect_select_multi: effect_select_multi 2 "echo" -> select effect echo in slot 2 effect_select_multi 1 -1 -> select previous effect in slot 1 effect_select_multi +1 -> select next effect in slot 1 effect_select_multi -> show popup window for slot 1 effect_select_multi 1 -> show popup window for slot 1 effect_select_multi 1 0.2 -> select the 2/10th effect from the list in slot 1 effect_select_multi "video" -> select effect in the video effect slot effect_select_multi does not deactivate the previous plugin in the specified slot
Actions.effect_select_popup: Same as effect_select, but shows the selection drop-down temporarily for easier selection
Actions.effect_select_toggle: Same as effect_select, but will turn on the new effect if the previous effect was on
Actions.effect_show_gui: show the control window for this effect
Actions.effect_slider: Move the n-th slider on the given effect "effect_slider 1 2 50%" : Set slider id 2 on slot 1 to 50% "effect_slider 1 0%" : set slider id 1 on slot 1 to 0%
Actions.effect_slider_active: move a slider and activate the effect as long as the mouse is down
Actions.effect_slider_reset: return this plugin slider to its default value
Actions.effect_slider_skip_length: Move the n-th slider on the given effect, excluding a length slider if present "effect_slider_skip_length 1 2 50%" : Set slider 2 (excluding length) on slot 1 to 50% "effect_slider_skip_length 1 0%" : set slider 1 (excluding length) on slot 1 to 0%
Actions.effect_stems: Apply effects only to the selected stems. 'effect_stems vocal on' Stems are Vocal,HiHat,Bass,Instru,Kick,Melody,Rhythm,MeloVocal or MeloRhythm
Actions.effect_stems_color: Get the color for the effect_stems button
Actions.effects_used: Active when there are any effects activated. Use "effects_used 'deck'" to get the effects on the selected deck, or "effects_used 'master'" to get effects activated on master.
Actions.eq_crossfader_high: crossfade the treble between both decks
Actions.eq_crossfader_low: crossfade the bass between both decks
Actions.eq_crossfader_mid: crossfade the center frequencies between both decks.
Actions.eq_high: change the amount of HiHat, Vocal or High (depending on EQ control mode).
Actions.eq_low: change the amount of Kick or Low in the mix (depending on EQ control mode).
Actions.eq_mid: change the amount of Melody, Vocals or Medium (depending on EQ control mode).
Actions.eq_mode: Select the behavior of the EQs knobs (frequency, modernEQ or EZRemix) Can be used to switch between Frequency and your preferred stems mode using 'eq_mode +1' To change the eq mode only for a single deck, use "eq_mode +1 deck" (or "deck 1 eq_mode +1 deck" to specify deck 1 in your script) To select a specific behavior, you can use "eq_mode frequency", "eq_mode modernEQ", "eq_mode ezRemix" or "eq_mode stems"
Actions.eventscheduler_start: Start the Event Scheduler (can specify one specific saved schedule: eventscheduler_start 'summer_wedding')
Actions.fadeout: 'loop & fadeout 10000ms 3000ms' will return 100% when loop is on, and fade out to 0% after 10 seconds in 3 seconds when loop turns off Alternatively, the action can be entered as the third parameter in backticks: 'fadeout 10000ms 3000ms `loop`'
Actions.fake_eq: tell VirtualDJ not to apply the equalizer to the sound output
Actions.fake_filter: tell VirtualDJ not to apply filter to sound output
Actions.fake_gain: tell VirtualDJ not to apply gain to the sound output
Actions.fake_hp: tell VirtualDJ not to apply headphone volume to headphone sound output
Actions.fake_hpmix: tell VirtualDJ not to apply headphone mix to headphone sound output
Actions.fake_master: tell VirtualDJ not to apply master volume to master sound output
Actions.fake_mixer: tell VirtualDJ not to apply the volumes to the sound output
Actions.fake_pfl: tell VirtualDJ to disable pfl switch from skin, when pfl can only be controlled from controller or mixer
Actions.file_count: Get number of files currently shown in browser You can also use 'automix', 'sideview', 'karaoke' or 'sidelist' as parameter to get the count in other lists. "file_count automix"
Actions.file_info: Open the Tag Editor for the specified or loaded song.
Actions.filter: apply the selected colorfx to the sound (nothing applied at 50%, and more applied the farther from the center)
Actions.filter_activate: enable or disable the deck filter
Actions.filter_label: get the text to display under the filter knob (use filter_label "clean" to always get the value, and filter_label "name" to always get the name)
Actions.filter_resonance: change the resonance of the filter
Actions.filter_selectcolorfx: Select the color effect controlled by the filter knob
Actions.flip_arm: When a flip is armed, it will start playing automatically when the play position reaches the beginning of the flip
Actions.flip_load: Load a previously saved flip, making it ready for playback
Actions.flip_loop: Activates flip looping, which will repeat playback of the flip when it reaches the end.
Actions.flip_play: Jump to the start of the recorded flip and starts playing it
Actions.flip_record: Prepare recording a new flip. Recording will start when the first cue point is pressed, and lasts until record is pressed again.
Actions.font_size: Change browser font size. Example: font_size +1
Actions.gain: set the gain of a deck
Actions.gain_label: get the text to display under the gain knob
Actions.gain_relative: change the gain, relative to the software gain position
Actions.get_active_loop: get the number of beats in the current loop
Actions.get_activedeck: get the number of the sync master deck
Actions.get_arm: get the position of the turntable arm
Actions.get_artist_before_feat: Return artist of the track, with 'featuring' stripped
Actions.get_artist_title_separator: Return a dash ( - ) if there is both an artist and a title
Actions.get_askthedj: Returns the latest request from ask the dj (requires askTheDJMonitoring setting to be on always) Use 'get_askthedj 2' to get the second latest request, etc.
Actions.get_askthedj_unread: Returns the number of unread Ask The DJ requests (requires askTheDJMonitoring setting to be on always)
Actions.get_automix: get the position of the automix crossfader
Actions.get_automix_position: Return position of currently playing song in automix list
Actions.get_automix_song: get a property from the next song in automix: "get_automix_song 'title'" you can also get properties from songs further down: "get_automix_song 'title' 2"
Actions.get_bar: returns the current bar number (1 bar = 4 beats)
Actions.get_battery: returns how much battery is left on your laptop
Actions.get_beat: get the intensity of the beat at the current position (0% to 100%).
Actions.get_beat_bar: get the position in % in the 4:4 bar (or in 4:16 if called with 'get beat_bar 16')
Actions.get_beat_counter: get the position of the beat counter
Actions.get_beat_num: "get_beat_num" returns a value between 1 and 4 indicating the beat in the measure "get_beat_num 1 4" returns true when the first beat of the measure is currently playing "get_beat_num 1" returns true when the first beat of a 4-beat measure is currently playing (works from 1 to 4) "get_beat_num 16" returns a percentage indicating the beat position in a 16-beat phrase (works with any phrase number larger than 4)
Actions.get_beat2: get the intensity of the beats from both decks at the same time.
Actions.get_beatdiff: Get the distance between the beat from this deck and the beat from the active deck 50% means the deck are aligned, 0% means this deck is late half a beat, 100% means it is ahead half a beat 'get_beatdiff 4' will return the distance percentage between bars instead of beats
Actions.get_beatgrid: get the intensity of the beat based on the beatgrid (100% if on the beat, 0% if halfway between to beats).
Actions.get_beatpos: get the current position in beatgrid coordinate (27.5 would mean halfway between the 27th and 28th beats in the song).
Actions.get_bpm: Get the bpm of the song Use 'get_bpm absolute' to get the original bpm of the song (not changing when changing the pitch)
Actions.get_browsed_color: 'get_browsed_color 0 red 255' (item, component, default) 'get_browsed_color 0 white' (item, default) returns color for selected item. This includes color filters. (For manually selected color only, use 'get_browsed_song color' instead)
Actions.get_browsed_filepath: get the filepath of the song currently selected in the browser
Actions.get_browsed_folder: get the name of the folder selected in the browser
Actions.get_browsed_folder_path: get the full path of the folder selected in the browser
Actions.get_browsed_folder_selection_index: 'get_browsed_folder_selection 1 3' returns true if the first line is the selected line in a browser 3 lines high 'get_browsed_folder_selection 3' returns the line number of the selected line in a browser 3 lines high (between 1 and 3)
Actions.get_browsed_selection_index: 'get_browsed_selection 1 3' returns true if the first line is the selected line in a browser 3 lines high 'get_browsed_selection 3' returns the line number of the selected line in a browser 3 lines high (between 1 and 3)
Actions.get_browsed_song: get a property from the currently browsed file: "get_browsed_song 'title'", "get browsed_song 'playcount'", etc...
Actions.get_clock: get the current time (use 'get_clock 12' to display AM/PM)
Actions.get_controller_image: Use in controller mappings to get the cover art from deck for use on controllers with screens
Actions.get_controller_name: return the name(s) of the controller(s) assigned to this deck
Actions.get_crossfader_result: get the actual volume balance between deck 1 and 2, based on crossfader, levels, and play (use get_crossfader_result "full" to show levels even for paused decks)
Actions.get_cue: returns the currently active cue, or 0 if no cue point is active
Actions.get_date: get the current date (use 'get_date "format"' to get the date in a specific format. format can include %Y, %m, %d for year, month and day, %A for weekday)
Actions.get_deck: get the number of the deck
Actions.get_deck_color: return blue or red if the deck is the left deck or right deck (and gray otherwise). Can be used with a darkness modifier: 'get_deck_color 50%' Use 'get_deck_color "absolute"' or 'get_deck_color "absolute" 50%' to get a color based on actual deck rather than left/right (red for deck 1, blue for deck 2, orange for deck 3, green for deck 4)
Actions.get_deck_letter: get the letter of the deck
Actions.get_decks: get the total number of decks of the current skin (can also be used with argument to compare: 'get_decks 4' returns true if 'get_decks' would return 4, false otherwise)
Actions.get_defaultdeck: get the number of the default deck
Actions.get_denon_cuepoints: 'get_denon_cuepoints 100' for a led bar with 100 leds. Number must match the number of leds in the led bar in the definition.
Actions.get_display: get some text to display. depending on the latest action, it can be the name of an effect, the folder being browsed, the title of the current song, etc... for multiline displays, you can add the line number: "get display 1", "get display 2".
Actions.get_effect_button_count: get the number of buttons on this effect
Actions.get_effect_button_name: get the name of the xth button of the currently selected effect
Actions.get_effect_button_shortname: get the short name of the xth button of the currently selected effect
Actions.get_effect_name: get the name of the currently selected effect
Actions.get_effect_slider_count: get the number of slider on this effect
Actions.get_effect_slider_default: returns the default value for this slider
Actions.get_effect_slider_label: get the label to display under this slider control
Actions.get_effect_slider_label_full: get the label to display under this slider control
Actions.get_effect_slider_name: get the name of the xth slider of the currently selected effect
Actions.get_effect_slider_shortname: get the shortname to display under this slider control
Actions.get_effect_slider_text: get the full text associated with this slider control
Actions.get_effect_string: get the text displayed by this effect. Some effects allow setting text as well
Actions.get_effect_string_name: get the label to display for this effect
Actions.get_effect_title: get the title of the currently selected effect
Actions.get_effects_used: Returns the number of effects currently active
Actions.get_featuring_after_artist: Return featuring artist, stripped from artist or title field
Actions.get_filepath: get the filepath of the song on the deck
Actions.get_firstbeat: get the position of the first beat (in milliseconds)
Actions.get_firstbeat_local: get the position of the first beat in the current phrase 16 beats (in milliseconds)
Actions.get_hasheadphones: True when a headphones output is configured in sound setup, or when the controller has a headphone volume control
Actions.get_hasinput: returns true if the current soundconfig includes any input (mic, linein or timecode)
Actions.get_haslinein: returns true if the current soundconfig includes some linein inputs
Actions.get_hasmaster: True when a master output is configured in sound setup, false for external mixer configurations
Actions.get_hasmic: returns true if the current soundconfig includes a mic input
Actions.get_hastimecode: returns true if the current soundconfig includes some timecode inputs
Actions.get_hwnd: return the Windows handle to VirtualDJ's window
Actions.get_karaoke_background_song: Get info about the background song playing in karaoke mode
Actions.get_key: get the key of the current song, based on keyDisplay option Use get_key "musical" or get_key "harmonic" to get a specific display independent of keyDisplay option
Actions.get_key_color: Return color of the current key of the track in the specified deck
Actions.get_key_modifier: get the number of semitone up or down currently applied to the song
Actions.get_key_modifier_text: get the number of semitone up or down currently applied to the song
Actions.get_leftdeck: get the number of the left deck
Actions.get_lemode: return true if we are running a LimitedEdition
Actions.get_level: Get level of signal before master volume. If no deck is specified will get master level Use "get_level 'mic'" for microphone level, or "get_level 'sampler'" for sampler level Use "get_level 'vocal'" for vocal vu meter, other stem names also supported
Actions.get_level_left: Get level of left channel before master volume. If no deck is specified will get master level.
Actions.get_level_left_peak: Get peak level of left channel before master volume. If no deck is specified will get master peak level.
Actions.get_level_log: Similar to get_level, but returns level on logarithmic scale where -127dB=0.0 and 0dB=1.0
Actions.get_level_peak: Get peak level of signal before master volume. If no deck is specified will get master peak level.
Actions.get_level_right: Get level of right channel before master volume. If no deck is specified will get master level.
Actions.get_level_right_peak: Get peak level of left channel before master volume. If no deck is specified will get master peak level.
Actions.get_limiter: return true if the limiter is compressing because the signal was saturated. Use 'deck 1 get limiter' to get the limiter on a deck in external mixer mode, or 'get_limiter' (or 'get_limiter "master") to get the limiter on the master for internal mixing mode (also can use 'get_limiter "headphones"' and 'get_limiter "booth"')
Actions.get_loaded_song: get a property from the song loaded on the deck: "deck 2 get_loaded_song 'album'"
Actions.get_loaded_song_color: 'get_loaded_song_color red 255' (component, default color) 'get_loaded_song_color white' (default color) returns color for the loaded track. This includes color filters. (For manually selected color only, use 'get_loaded_song color' instead)
Actions.get_loop: get the number of beats in the current loop or the default loop size if no loop is active
Actions.get_loop_in_time: Get time (in ms) of the start of the loop Use "get_loop_in_time 1.0" to return the time in seconds instead of milliseconds Use "get_loop_in_time on" to return the loop in time even when no loop is active
Actions.get_loop_out_time: Get time (in ms) of the end of the loop Use "get_loop_out_time 1.0" to return the time in seconds instead of milliseconds Use "get_loop_out_time on" to return the loop out time even when no loop is active
Actions.get_next_karaoke_song: Get info about the upcoming karaoke tracks Example 'get_next_karaoke_song "singer" +1'
Actions.get_phrase_num: "get_phrase_num" returns a value between 1 and 4 indicating the measure number "get_phrase_num 1" returns true when the first measure of the phrase is currently playing
Actions.get_pitch: Get the pitch from -100% to +100%, centered on 0%
Actions.get_pitch_value: Get the pitch from 0% to 200%, centered on 100%
Actions.get_pitch_zero: Is true if the pitch is zero, with an optional precision parameter: 'get pitch_zero 5%' (the % is relative to the pitch range. Use "get pitch_zero 'absolute' 0.1%" to use absolute precision)
Actions.get_playlist_time: Gets how much time is left before the end of the automix playlist
Actions.get_plugindeck: For use in plugins. Returns 1,2,etc... when plugin is active on a deck, 0 for master, -1 for sampler, -2 for mic
Actions.get_position: get the position in the song
Actions.get_record_message: get the message displayed on the record page
Actions.get_record_min: get the minutes of the recording time
Actions.get_record_ms: get the milliseconds of the recording time
Actions.get_record_msf: get the frames of the recording time
Actions.get_record_sec: get the seconds of the recording time
Actions.get_record_size: get the current size of the recording file
Actions.get_record_time: get the time already spent recording
Actions.get_remix_after_title: Return remix of the track loaded on the deck like "(remix)" Remix will automatically be extracted from title if remix field is empty
Actions.get_rightdeck: get the number of the right deck
Actions.get_rotation: get the angle of the disc
Actions.get_rotation_cue: get the angle of the cue point on the disc
Actions.get_rotation_slip: get the angle of the slip point on the disc when slip is active, or regular get_rotation otherwise
Actions.get_sample_color: get the color for the specified sample (with auto-dim)
Actions.get_sample_info: get additional information about the sample, such as 'get_sample_info 1 fullpath' In addition to the regular column names, 'group' is also supported, and 'length' returns beat values for loops
Actions.get_sample_name: get the name of the specified sample
Actions.get_sampler_bank: get the name of the currently loaded sampler bank
Actions.get_sampler_bank_count: get the number of sample banks
Actions.get_sampler_bank_id: get the number of the currently loaded sampler bank
Actions.get_sampler_count: get the number of slots in the current sampler bank
Actions.get_sampler_slot: get the number of the sampler slot that currently has the focus
Actions.get_saved_loop: get information about a saved loop: get_saved_loop 'pos', get_saved_loop 'length', get_saved_loop 'name' "get_saved_loop 'next' 'name'" can be used to get information about the upcoming saved loop "get_saved_loop 1 'name'" can be used to get information about the first saved loop
Actions.get_slip_time: Get the time where the song will be when slip mode is de-activated in milliseconds Alternatively, use get_slip_time "min", get_slip_time "sec" and get_slip_time "msec"
Actions.get_song_event: Provide analysis about current and coming events in the song. Can be used when writing visualisation plugins. The first parameter is "current" or "next" to get the current or the coming event. The second parameter can be "hasbeats", "volume", "volume_end", "remaining"
Actions.get_songlength: get the length in seconds of the song on the deck
Actions.get_spectrum_band: get the level of a single spectrum band. 'get_spectrum_band 1' Use 'deck master' in front to get spectrum of the master deck 'deck master get_spectrum_band 1' By default there are 32 bands, to use a smaller number of bands, use 'get_spectrum_band 1 3' to get the first of 3 bands The third parameter can be used to get a spectrum of stems 'get_spectrum_band 1 32 vocals'
Actions.get_text:
get some text. You can use the inverted apostrophe to query VDJScript results within the text: "get text 'You are listening to `get loaded_song "title"` at `volume` volume.".
VDJScript returning booleans (buttons) will be displayed as "on" or "off".
VDJScript returning values (sliders) will be displayed as a percentage.
(you can also (but it's being deprecated in VDJ7) use % shortcuts for some common queries: "get text 'you are listening to %title by %author'")
Actions.get_time: get the elapsed time (or remaining or total depending on "display_time"), in milliseconds. Use 'get time 1000' to get another unit than ms (1000=ms, 25=1/25th of seconds, 44100=frames, etc). Use "elapsed", "remain" or "total" to bypass the setting of display_time. Use "absolute" not to take the pitch into account. On texts, use "short" to hide the decimals. Example: get_time "remain" "short"
Actions.get_time_hour: Get the hours of the elapsed time (or remaining or total, depending on "display_time") Use 'get_time_hour "absolute"' if you don't want to take the pitch variations into account You can write 'get_time_hour "elapsed"' or "remain" or "total" to bypass the setting of display_time
Actions.get_time_min: get the minutes of the elapsed time (or remaining or total, depending on "display_time"). use 'get time_min "absolute"' if you don't want to take the pitch variations in account. you can write 'get time_min "elapsed"' or "remain" or "total" to bypass the setting of display_time
Actions.get_time_ms: get the 1/100th seconds of the elapsed time (or remaining or total, depending on "display_time") use 'get_time_ms 1000' to get the actual milliseconds
Actions.get_time_msf: get the MSF frame of the elapsed time (or remaining or total, depending on "display_time").
Actions.get_time_sec: get the seconds of the elapsed time (or remaining or total, depending on "display_time").
Actions.get_time_sign: Get the sign (-1 or +1) of the elapsed time (or remaining or total, depending on "display_time") You can write 'get_time_sign "elapsed"' or "remain" or "total" to bypass the setting of display_time
Actions.get_title_before_remix: Return title of the track. If remix is empty, the part in brackets in the title is removed (and shown by get_remix_after_title)
Actions.get_title_remix: Return combination of title and remix: "Title (Remix)".
Actions.get_totaltime_min: get the minutes of the length of the song
Actions.get_totaltime_ms: get the 1/100th seconds of the length of the song
Actions.get_totaltime_msf: get the frames of the length of the song
Actions.get_totaltime_sec: get the seconds of the length of the song
Actions.get_var: get the value of the specified variable
Actions.get_vdj_folder: return the home folder of VirtualDJ.
Actions.get_version: Returns version as text such as "2025"
Actions.get_video_fx_slider_label: get the text to display under this slider control
Actions.get_videofx_name: get the name of the currently selected video effect
Actions.get_videotrans_name: get the name of the currently selected video transition
Actions.get_volume: get the volume applied by both the volume sliders and the crossfader
Actions.get_vu_meter: Get level of signal after master volume. If no deck is specified will get master level. Use "get_vu_meter 'mic'" for microphone level or "get_vu_meter 'sampler'" for sampler level Use "get_level 'vocal'" for vocal vu meter, other stem names also supported
Actions.get_vu_meter_left: Get level of left channel after master volume. If no deck is specified will get master level.
Actions.get_vu_meter_left_peak: Get peak level of left channel after master volume. If no deck is specified will get master peak level.
Actions.get_vu_meter_peak: Get peak level of signal after master volume. If no deck is specified will get master peak level.
Actions.get_vu_meter_right: Get level of right channel after master volume. If no deck is specified will get master level.
Actions.get_vu_meter_right_peak: Get peak level of right channel after master volume. If no deck is specified will get master peak level.
Actions.getfood: because no DJ should work on an empty stomach
Actions.goto: change the position in the song. 'goto +10ms' jumps 10ms forward. 'goto -4' jumps 4 beats backward. 'goto 20%' jumps to 20% of the song's length.
Actions.goto_bar: put the song on its nth beat after the downbeat without loosing sync: 'goto_bar 4'
Actions.goto_cue: Go to the specified cue. Example "goto_cue 1", "goto_cue +1", "goto_cue -1" "goto_cue" will jump to the currently selected/last used cue.
Actions.goto_first_beat: automatically goes to the first beat in the song.
Actions.goto_last_folder: Go back to the last browsed folder
Actions.goto_mixpoint: Jump to the specified mix point ("StartTempo", "EndTempo", "StartCut", "EndCut", "StartFade", "EndFade", "StartSound", "EndSound") Example: goto_mixpoint "StartCut"
Actions.goto_start: go to the start of the song.
Actions.grid_view: put the browser in grid-view mode, optimized for touch screens
Actions.handshake: Perform an encrypted handshake to ensure that this plugin is currently being called by a real VirtualDJ environment. Call this passing any string, decrypt the result using VirtualDJ's handshake public key, and check that it matches what you passed. See the developer documentation on our website for example code.
Actions.has_aux: returns true if the current soundconfig includes a aux input
Actions.has_battery: returns true if your computer has batteries
Actions.has_cue: returns true if the specified cue number is set
Actions.has_custom_button: returns true if this custom button has an action assigned to it
Actions.has_karaoke_next: On when karaoke mode is active and there is still another singer queued
Actions.has_linked_tracks: Returns true when track has links to other tracks. On a button can be used to show the linked tracks in the sideview You can also use 'has_linked_tracks browsed' to get the result for the currently browsed track Passing a script that returns a full file path is also possible using 'has_linked_tracks `script`'
Actions.has_notch: return true when the display has a notch at the top center and the skin is maximized, false otherwise
Actions.has_quick_filter: Return true if quick filter with given index exists
Actions.has_stems: Return true if the track has stems available. Can also be called with 'has_stems "2.0"' to check for new engine, or 'has_stems "ready"' to check if stems are ready at the current playing position
Actions.has_system_volume: Returns true when the system volume can be modified
Actions.has_video_mix: return true if video output is using transition and video-crossfader with one or more video sources, false if it's playing audio-only and using a source plugin
Actions.headphone_crossfader: change the PFL fader (0% is only the left deck, 100% is only the right deck).
Actions.headphone_gain: change the gain of the PFL output (from -30dB to +30dB)
Actions.headphone_mix: change the mix of the PFL (0% is only the cued deck, 100% is the master output).
Actions.hold: 'hold on' or 'hold off' (or 'hold toggle') to stop the disc for scratching, or release it.
Actions.holding: execute different actions depending if the key is pressed for a long time or not: 'holding ? automix : mix_now'. you can specify the time ('holding 1000ms'), by default it's 500ms.
Actions.hot_cue: if no cue point is set, or if 'cue', 'cue_stop' or 'cue_play' is pressed, set one at the current position. otherwise go to the cue point and start or continue playing. if in loop, set the cue point as new loop_in but keep loop_length. you can specify a number ('hot_cue 1', 'hot_cue 57') to work with several cues.
Actions.info_options: show the context menu about the info panel fields and prelisten behavior
Actions.invert_controllers: Invert the deck of the controllers
Actions.invert_deck: switch leftdeck between deck 1 and deck 3 or rightdeck between deck 2 and deck 4 "invert_deck" to swap the calling deck, or "invert_deck 'left'", "invert_deck 'right'" to specifically switch left or right deck
Actions.invert_timecode: Invert timecode control (for 1 timecode source, switch it through available decks, for 2 timecode sources, from 1 to 3, 2 to 4)
Actions.is_audible: active if the deck is playing and volume is up (on-air)
Actions.is_audioonlyvisualisation: return true if this deck has the audio only visualisation running on it
Actions.is_battery: returns true if your computer is running on batteries
Actions.is_karaoke_idle: On when karaoke mode is active but not playing. (Background music may be playing)
Actions.is_karaoke_playing: On when karaoke track is playing and karaoke mode is active. Off when background music is playing
Actions.is_mac: return true if the computer is a MAC, false if it's a PC
Actions.is_pc: return true if the computer is a PC, false if it's a MAC (example: <panel visible="is_pc" />)
Actions.is_releasefx: query if this effect is in the release effect slot
Actions.is_sync: on when tracks are synchronized (bpm and phase while playing, bpm when not playing)
Actions.is_using: check if a particular feature is being used ('filter', 'equalizer', 'loop', 'cue', 'sample', 'pads', 'effect', 'load')
Actions.is_video: return true if this deck has some video
Actions.isrepeat: execute different actions depending if the key is being repeated or if it's the first message (on Windows, keyboard shortcuts are usually auto-repeated while held down): 'isrepeat ? nothing : goto_cue')
Actions.jogwheel: used for a jogwheel without touch sensitivity. 'jogwheel +1.0' means a full rotation of the wheel.
Actions.karaoke: Start or stop automatic karaoke loading and background music
Actions.karaoke_add: Add the songs selected in the browser to the karaoke list
Actions.karaoke_load: Load the folder or playlist selected in the browser in the karaoke list Use "karaoke_load 'append'" to add the selected folder to the karaoke list instead of replacing the existing karaoke
Actions.karaoke_options: show the contextmenu with the karaoke options
Actions.karaoke_show: show the singer list on the video output
Actions.key: change the key of the song, from -12 (one octave down) to +12 (one octave up), only in multiple of semitones.
Actions.key_lock: activate/deactivate the key lock (to make the pitch slider change the speed of the song, but keep the key of the song like it is now).
Actions.key_match_button: Match key to the other deck's key on first press, or reset key to normal on second press
Actions.key_match_menu: Open a menu to select a different key for the current song
Actions.key_move: move the key up or down from the given amount of semitones.
Actions.key_smooth: change the key of the song, from -6 (half octave down) to +6 (half octave up), allowing not only multiple of semitones. use key_smooth full for full octave up or down
Actions.keyboard_shortcuts: Map to CTRL or ALT. While pressed will show keyboard overlay in browser. Double-press to activate sticky keys. Accepts time to delay showing overlay (keyboard_shortcuts 500ms). In scripts can also be used to turn on or off the overlay manually (keyboard_shortcuts on)
Actions.keycue_pad: change the key depending on the pad and play the current cue point
Actions.keycue_pad_color: green for the selected key, magenta for lower keys, orange for higher keys and white for no key change
Actions.keycue_pad_jump: when on, keycue_pad will jump to the cue point on each press, when off, keycue_pad will only modify the key without jumping to the cue point
Actions.keycue_pad_page: change the offset of the key change by keycue_pad actions
Actions.leftcross: assign this deck to the left of the crossfader: "deck 3 leftcross" "deck 3 leftcross 'only'" to assign only deck 3 to left of the crossfader "leftcross 'none'" to disable the left crossfader
Actions.leftdeck: select this deck to be the left deck: "deck 3 leftdeck" or "leftdeck +1"
Actions.leftvideo: assign this deck to the left of the video crossfader: "deck 3 leftvideo" or "leftvideo +1" or "leftvideo 'auto'".
Actions.leftvideo_button: simple button to control the left video source: "deck 3 leftvideo_button".
Actions.level: set the volume of the deck
Actions.levelfader_curve: select the curve of the level faders. 0% is a linear curve, 50% (default) is a quadratic curve, 100% is a cubic curve
Actions.linein: Activate or deactivate the linein on this deck. You can also specify a linein number to assign another linein: "deck 1 linein 2 on" Or you can assign the microphone or aux input: "deck 3 linein 'mic' on" or "deck 3 linein 'aux' on" If you don't want the line in to become the master deck automatically, you can use "deck 3 linein 'trs'"
Actions.linein_rec: record the linein input on this deck.
Actions.load: load the selected song on the deck. you can also specify a fullpath to load 'load "path_to_my_song"'.
Actions.load_deck_set: Reload a previously saved deck_set file
Actions.load_next: Load next track. You can use 'load_next keepplay' to start playing the loaded song if the currently loaded song was playing
Actions.load_pulse: return a brief false then true again when a new song is loaded
Actions.load_pulse_active: return true when a new song becomes audible for the specified duration. Can be delayed using the second parameter. 'load_pulse_active 1000ms 5000ms' will return true for 1 second, 5 seconds after a new song becomes audible
Actions.load_skin: load a new skin. Use syntax " load_skin ':newvariation' " to load a different variation inside the same skin file.
Actions.loaded: return true if a song is loaded on the deck
Actions.loaded_song: set a property of the currently loaded file: "loaded_song 'rating' 5", ...
Actions.loaded_song_hashtag: add or remove a hash tag from user1, user2 or comment of the currently loaded song: "loaded_song_hashtag 'user 1' '#high_energy'"
Actions.lock_cues: lock/unlock the cues for this particular song, so that cue actions cannot inadvertently modify them while you're playing
Actions.lock_panel: NOTE: despite the name, this action acts on <split> elements, not <panel>
Actions.log_search: log the current search in the SearchLog.txt file, so you can easily search for your failed requests once the gig is over.
Actions.loop: set or remove a loop. 'loop 4', 'loop 0.5' set a loop in beats. 'loop 10ms' set a loop in ms. 'loop 200%' multiply by 2 the size of the loop. 'loop 50%' divides by 2. 'loop' alone set a loop at the actual position with the same beat size as the last set loop.
Actions.loop_adjust: use the jogwheel to adjust the loop. loop_adjust 'move', loop_adjust 'out', loop_adjust 'in' activate a specific loop adjust mode loop_adjust -1, loop_adjust +1 emulate moving the jog when loop adjust is active
Actions.loop_back: When loop back mode is enabled, starting a loop sets the end point of the loop, looping what you just heard. When disabled, starting a loop sets the start point of the loop.
Actions.loop_button: one-button smart loop: Set the loop in on the first press, set the loop out on second press, remove the loop on third press.
Actions.loop_color: query or set the color of a saved loop Query example: loop_color 1 Set example: loop_color 1 'yellow'
Actions.loop_delete: 'loop_delete 1' Delete the saved loop in slot 1
Actions.loop_double: doubles the length of the loop.
Actions.loop_half: halves the length of the loop.
Actions.loop_in: if not in loop, set the beginning of a loop. if in loop, jump back to the beginning of the loop.
Actions.loop_length: change the length of the loop. 'loop_length 15ms' set the length in ms, 'loop_length 0.5' set the length in beats, 'loop_length +100%' set the length in percentage of the actual length.
Actions.loop_load: 'loop_load 1' Load the saved loop from slot 1 'loop_load "myloop"' Load saved loop named "myloop"
Actions.loop_load_prepare: 'loop_load_prepare 1' Activate/Deactivate the saved loop in slot 1 without jumping to the start point 'loop_load_prepare "myloop"' Activate/Deactivate stored loop named "myloop" without jumping to the start point
Actions.loop_move: move the loop without changing its length. 'loop_move +10ms' set the distance in ms, 'loop_move +2' set the distance in beats, 'loop_move +50%' set the distance in percentage of the actual length.
Actions.loop_out: if not in loop, set the deck in loop, starting from the last set loop_in point or stutter point. if in loop, exit the loop.
Actions.loop_pad: Use 'loop_pad 1' to 'loop_pad 8' to trigger a loop of predefined length, depending on loop_pad_page and loop_pad_mode
Actions.loop_pad_mode: Cycle through the different loop modes for use with loop_pad. 1=On/Off 2=Hold 3=Roll
Actions.loop_pad_page: Cycle through the different lengths of loops for use with loop_pad
Actions.loop_position: Get relative position in loop (from 0% to 100%)
Actions.loop_roll: "loop_roll 0.25" for 1/4th beat loop roll "loop_roll video" to toggle video loop roll on or off
Actions.loop_roll_mode: If loop roll mode is active, when the loop exits, the song continues from the position it should have been if no looping had been done
Actions.loop_save: 'loop_save 1' Save current loop in saved loop slot 1 'loop_save "myloop"' Save current loop and name it "myloop"
Actions.loop_select: set the loop size (or default loop size if no loop is active). If no parameter is provided, a popup list of loop values to choose from will be displayed.
Actions.macro_record: Start or stop recording a macro
Actions.mark_linked_tracks: Mark the tracks in deck 1 and 2 as linked. (Linked tracks can be shown in the remixes tab of the sideview)
Actions.master_balance: change the left/right balance on the master output.
Actions.master_tempo: activate/deactivate the master tempo (to make the pitch slider change the speed of the song, but keep the original key of the song).
Actions.masterdeck: select/unselect this deck as 'master deck'. When a master deck is set, all synchronization operations will take the master deck as reference. (for skins with more than 2 decks)
Actions.masterdeck_auto: remove the masterdeck selection and put back automatic masterdeck behavior
Actions.match_bpm: set the pitch to match the BPM of the other deck.
Actions.match_gain: set the gain to match the other deck.
Actions.match_key: change the key of the song to match the given key. you can use standard notation ('match_key "A#m"') or numeric ('match_key "03A"'). if no given key, it will use the other deck. the change will be the smallest change to make it compatible with the given key.
Actions.maximize: maximize the application to maximized, full screen, or back to windowed. A specific mode can be selected using "maximize 'windowed'", "maximize 'maximized'" or "maximize 'fullscreen'"
Actions.menu: display a menu on the controller's screen, that allows to change the behaviour of the menu_buttons. you can navigate through the menu using the browser_scroll action'.
Actions.menu_button: defines a button whose behaviour can be changed by a menu. Syntax: 'menu_button 1 "hotcue,sampler,effect,loop"'.
Actions.menu_cycledisplay: on single-line controllers, cycle display when no menu is shown between artist - title, artist or title
Actions.mic: activate or deactivate the microphone input
Actions.mic_rec: record the microphone input on this deck
Actions.mic_talkover: Lower the volume of all decks while active and activates microphone Use 'mic_talkover while_pressed' to only activate mic as long as button is held Use 'mic_talkover 20% 1000ms' to lower deck volumes to 20% and fade to the volume in 1 second. (Defaults are 30% and 400ms)
Actions.mic_volume: Set the volume of the microphone
Actions.mic2_volume: Set the volume of the second microphone
Actions.microphone: activate or deactivate the microphone input
Actions.midiclock_active: Toggle sending midiclock to the specified controller
Actions.miditovst_active: Toggle sending midi from a specific controller to the specified deck's VST instruments or effects
Actions.minimize: minimize the application in the taskbar.
Actions.mix_and_load_next: automatically mix to the next deck, then stop the current track and load a new song if something is available in the playlist or sidelist by default this will to a tempo mix and sync bpm if the bpm is in range. You can add 'nosync' to mix without tempo synchronization. 'mix_and_load_next nosync'
Actions.mix_next: If the non-playing deck has a song loaded that has already been played, load a new one from the playlist. Then smoothly crossfade from the playing deck to the other, using beatsync if appropriate
Actions.mix_next_sidelist: If the non-playing deck has a song loaded that has already been played, load a new one from the sidelist. Then smoothly crossfade from the playing deck to the other, using beatsync if appropriate
Actions.mix_now: Smoothly crossfade from one side to the other, matching beats when the tempo of both songs is close together When automix is off, fade speed can be adjusted: "mix_now 4000ms" or "mix_now 4bt"
Actions.mix_now_nosync: Smoothly crossfade from one side to the other When automix is off, fade speed can be adjusted: "mix_now_nosync 4000ms" or "mix_now_nosync 4bt"
Actions.mix_selected: When automix is active, mix to the song currently selected
Actions.mixer_order: For controllers with 4 decks, specify the order of the decks, from left to right. Default: "mixer_order 3124"
Actions.mixermode: Return true if internal mixer used (master output available), false if external mixer used. Parameter can also be explicit: mixermode "internal" or mixermode "external"
Actions.mono_mix: Mix left and right channels together for all outputs
Actions.motor_switch: assign this deck to be controlled by the motorized wheel
Actions.motorwheel: used for a motorized jogwheel. Each time the jogwheel moves, send 'motorwheel "move" +1.0' followed by 'motorwheel "timestamp" 1000.0'. 'move +1.0' means a full platter rotation. 'timestamp 1.0' means 1ms since last message. You should query 'motorwheel' and turn the motor on when it returns true and off when false.
Actions.motorwheel_instant_play: when set to on, the song will start instantly, bypassing the ramp up time the motor takes to reach its full rotation speed (the drawback is that then you cannot hold the disc still when your start the motor)
Actions.move_deck: load the song from the called deck into the deck specified by the parameter and unloads the song from the calling deck
Actions.multibutton_select: Open the selection menu for the named multibutton. If a second text parameter is provided after the name, use it as the new action to load in the multibutton: 'multibutton_select "my_button" "goto_cue 2 & play"'
Actions.mute_stem: mute one stem. Stem names are: "HiHat", "Vocal", "Instru", "Bass", "Kick", or you can use aggregate stems: "Melody" (Instru+Bass), "Rhythm" (HiHat+Kick), "MeloRhythm" (Instru+Bass+HiHat+Kick)
Actions.not_played: don't mark the song on this deck as 'played'.
Actions.nudge: 'nudge +120ms' to nudge the song 120ms forward (using mastertempo if it's activated).
Actions.numark_waveform_zoom: Set numark waveform zoom (value from 0 to 3, or +1, -1 to step through zoom levels)
Actions.only_stem: keep only one stem. Stem names are: "HiHat", "Vocal", "Instru", "Bass", "Kick", or you can use aggregate stems: "Melody" (Instru+Bass), "Rhythm" (HiHat+Kick), "MeloRhythm" (Instru+Bass+HiHat+Kick)
Actions.os2l_button: Send a command to a DMX software over OS2L: 'os2l_button "blackout"', 'os2l_button "fog machine" while_pressed', etc. If you want to specify a page, you can use 'os2l_button "mypage" "mybutton"'. If the DMX software doesn't send feedback commands, os2l_button acts as a flash button (it sends 'on' when pressed, 'off' when released) - use 'os2l_button "mybutton" on' to not send commands on release. If the DMX software sends feedback commands, os2l_button acts as a toggle button (it sends the opposite of the last feedback when pressed, nothing on release) - use 'os2l_button "mybutton" while_pressed' to send a command on release.
Actions.os2l_cmd: Send a numeric command to a DMX software over OS2L: 'os2l_cmd 42 on' or 'os2l_cmd 43 50%'
Actions.os2l_scene: similar to os2l_button, but sends 'on' to the DMX software only if the button was not active yet, and only if the deck is audible. (requires feedback from the DMX software) when the deck is not audible, the scene will be queued and started when the deck becomes audible os2l_scene "scene1" os2l_scene "mypage" "myscene"
Actions.over_video: force this deck's video output on the video master
Actions.pad: activate the ith pad from the current pad page
Actions.pad_bank2: Switch between showing pads 1-8 or 9-16 on skins that support it
Actions.pad_button_color: returns the color of the ith pad as should be used on a controller button (changing the color for standby/active/pressed according to the controller's RGB capability). if the pad is active and has no color, white is returned. if the pad is inactive and has a color, and the controller support full RGB pads, a dimmed color is returned. if the pad is active and has a color, and the controller doesn't support full RGB pads, the color is blinking.
Actions.pad_color: return the color of the ith pad (without auto-dim)
Actions.pad_has_16pads: Returns true when a controller is connected with a 4x4 pad layout
Actions.pad_menu: open the menu for this pad page
Actions.pad_page: Syntax: 'pad_page 1' to activate a the first page, 'pad_page 1 hotcues' to override the default for a page, 'pad_page btn1' for first button (that could be page 1 or page 5 depending on shift), 'pad_page' to show the dropdown menu
Actions.pad_page_insplit: Return true if the referenced page is part of a split (both for top and bottom pad)
Actions.pad_page_select: Select the pad page for this slot
Actions.pad_param: change the param 1 of the pads
Actions.pad_param2: change the param 2 of the pads
Actions.pad_pressure: change the pressure applied on the ith pad
Actions.pad_pressure_switch: Toggle use of pressure for pads on or off
Actions.pad_pushed: returns true if the pad is pushed (useful for custom color actions not using auto-dim)
Actions.padfx: Activate/deactivate named effect with a single key. Effect parameters can be specified as well. 'padfx "echo" 40% 90%' to start/stop the echo effect with first parameter at 40% and second parameter at 90%. When the effect is stopped, the parameters return to their original values. 'padfx "echo" 40% 1bt' to start/stop the echo effect with first parameter at 40% and length of 1 beat 'padfx "echo" 40% 90% smart_pressed' smart_pressed works as a toggle when pressing the button shortly, or as a temporary while holding the button pressed 'padfx "echo" 40% 90% "TRAIL:on"' after the sliders, it is possible to add strings to disable or enable switch parameters by defining their name, a colon and "on" to enable or "off" to disable 'padfx "echo out" 80% "solostem:vocal"' as the last parameter, you can add solostem:stemname to only let that stem be audible while applying the effect 'padfx "echo out" "mutestem:rhythm"' as the last parameter, you can add mutestem:stemname to mute that stem while applying the effect 'padfx "reverb" "stemfx:vocal"' as the last parameter, you can add stemfx:stemname to apply the effect only to that stem (other stems will continue playing normally) stem names can be Vocal,HiHat,Bass,Instru,Kick,Melody,Rhythm,MeloVocal,MeloRhythm
Actions.padfx_single: Same as padfx, but turns off the previous padfx before activating the current effect
Actions.padshift: the 'pad' action automatically change action on shift, but if you want to manually force the use of the shift action, you can use padshift instead
Actions.padshift_button_color: the 'pad_button_color' action automatically change action on shift, but if you want to manually force the use of the shift action, you can use padshift_button_color instead
Actions.padshift_pressure: the 'pad_pressure' action automatically change action on shift, but if you want to manually force the use of the shift action, you can use padshift_pressure instead
Actions.param_1_x: invert the value of the calling slider/encoder/button (calculate 1/x) 'param_1_x & effect slider'
Actions.param_add: add the given value to the value of the calling slider/encoder/button add the value of the first parameter with the value of the second parameter. Both parameters can be actions instead of values: 'param_add `get_var a` `get_var b`'
Actions.param_bigger: check if the value of the calling slider/encoder/button is bigger than something: 'param_bigger 0 ? sampler loop 200% : sampler loop 50%' compare value of the first parameter with the value of the second parameter. Both parameters can be actions instead of values: 'param_bigger pitch pitch_slider'
Actions.param_cast: cast the value of the previous query action into a new type: 'pitch_range & param_cast "percentage"'. Valid types are 'integer', 'float', 'percentage', 'ms', 'boolean', 'beats', 'text'. casting to text can also optionally limit the number of characters: 'get_browsed_song "artist" & param_cast "text" 5' to format a number as text with a specific number of digits: 'get_bpm & param_cast "000"' param_cast 'int_trunc' : provides the integer part of a number without rounding to the nearest integer param_cast 'frac' : provides the decimal part of a number. param_cast 'relative' and param_cast 'absolute' : change the parameter to be a relative or absolute value
Actions.param_contains: Check if the value of the calling action contains the string in the parameter.
Actions.param_delta: transform an absolute value into relative (example: 0.5, 0.7, 0.8 will become +0.0, +0.2, +0.1)
Actions.param_equal: Check if the value of the calling slider/encoder/button is equal to something To compare a string with the result of an action, use param_equal `action param` "string". For example: param_equal `get_browsed_song 'type'` "audio"
Actions.param_invert: invert the value of the calling slider/encoder/button (1-x): 'param_invert & pitch_slider'
Actions.param_lowercase: change the text result of the previous element in the script into lowercase
Actions.param_make_discrete: useful for smooth endless encoders, to make them discrete Example: 'param_make_discrete 0.1 & param_bigger 0 ? loop_move +100% : param_smaller 0 ? loop_move - 100%'
Actions.param_mod: wrap the value of the calling slider/encoder if more than the given value
Actions.param_multiply: multiply the value of the calling slider/encoder/button by the given value: 'param_multiply 300% & effect slider' The parameter can also be an action 'cue_pos 0 & param_multiply "get_time total 1000"'
Actions.param_pingpong: transform the value of the calling slider/encoder from a linear scale to a forth-and-back scale
Actions.param_pow: param_pow y : computes the power of the caller to the power of y. Can be 0.5 for calculating square root.
Actions.param_smaller: check if the value of the calling slider/encoder/button is smaller than something: 'param_smaller 0 ? sampler loop 200% : sampler loop 50%'
Actions.param_ucfirst: change the first letter into upper case and the rest in lower case
Actions.param_uppercase: change the text result of the previous element in the script into uppercase
Actions.pause_stop: if playing, pause the deck. if stopped, rewind to beginning of the song, then cycle through all cue points each time pressed.
Actions.pfl: select if this deck is sent to the headphones. (can be used with a slider or a % to specify the volume: 'pfl 75%')
Actions.phrase_sync: shift by a number of beat to match the phrase of the other deck (default 4:4, but can specify 'phrase_sync 16' for example)
Actions.pioneer_cue: On when playing or paused on cue, blinking when paused and not on cue, off when no track loaded
Actions.pioneer_play: On when playing, off when no track loaded, blinking when paused or playing with cue stutter
Actions.pitch: Set the pitch of the deck. Without parameters it can be assigned to sliders Used with a number, it gives the position on the slider (and therefore account for pitch_range). ('pitch 0.25' set pitch at -10% if pitch range is 20%) Used with a percent it gives an absolute position. 'pitch 112%' set pitch at +12% Relative values are possible too. 'pitch +0.1%', 'pitch +0.1 bpm' When used with 'bpm', the pitch is set to match the bpm. 'pitch 130 bpm' set pitch to match 130 bpm
Actions.pitch_bend: slow down or speed up the song: 'pitch_bend +3%'. you can make the bend to increase slowly by specifying a second time parameter: 'pitch_bend +1% 500ms' will start at +1% and will double every 500ms.
Actions.pitch_lock: when Pitch Lock is on, moving the pitch slider on one deck will move the slider on the other deck to keep the sync
Actions.pitch_range: set the range for the pitch slider. 'pitch_range 12%' set the range from -12% to +12%. 'pitch_range +1' scrolls through the default pitch ranges. 'pitch_range "12,16,25" +1' scrolls through the provided list of pitch ranges. 'pitch_range +1 deck' changes the pitch range only for the specific deck
Actions.pitch_relative: set the pitch of the deck, to be used by hardware controllers if you prefer the change to be relative to the software pitch position
Actions.pitch_reset: Slowly brings the pitch back to 0%. You can specify the speed in % per second (default uses the pitchResetSpeed option): 'pitch_reset 5%' You can also specify the speed in ms or beats: 'pitch_reset 500ms' or 'pitch_reset 4bt'
Actions.pitch_zero: Set pitch to 0% (normal playing speed) Use 'pitch_zero "center"' on controllers that send a message when the pitch slider is at the center. This prevents unwanted behavior in gradual or relative mode.
Actions.pitchlock: when Pitch Lock is on, moving the pitch slider on one deck will move the slider on the other deck to keep the sync
Actions.play_button: depending on the play_mode, act like play_stutter (Numark way) or play_pause (Pioneer way).
Actions.play_mode: set the mode for play/stop/cue buttons: 'play_mode "numark"', or 'play_mode "pioneer"'.
Actions.play_onbeat: instantly synchronize the song with the other deck, using local beat information instead of the global beatgrid, but don't change the pitch.
Actions.play_options: show a context menu to select the behavior of the play and cue buttons, and the various smart modes
Actions.play_pause: if paused, start the deck. if playing, pause the deck.
Actions.play_stutter: if paused, start the deck. if playing, restart from last stutter point.
Actions.play_sync: play the song instantly synchronized with the other deck.
Actions.play_sync_onbeat: instantly synchronize the song with the other deck, using local beat information instead of the global beatgrid.
Actions.playlist_add: Add the songs selected in the browser to the automix list
Actions.playlist_load: Load the folder or playlist selected in the browser in the playlist. Use "playlist_load 'append'" to add the selected folder to the playlist instead of replacing the existing playlist
Actions.playlist_load_and_keep: Load the first song in the automix list on the deck, without removing it from the list
Actions.playlist_load_and_remove: Load the first song in the automix list on the deck, and remove it from list
Actions.playlist_options: display a drop-down with the list of options for the playlist.
Actions.playlist_randomize: shuffle the order of the songs in the playlist.
Actions.playlist_randomize_once: shuffle the order of the songs in the playlist once.
Actions.playlist_remove_duplicates: remove duplicate songs from the playlist.
Actions.playlist_remove_played: remove from the playlist all the songs that have already been played since the software was launched.
Actions.playlist_repeat: repeat (or stop to repeat) the playlist while automixing.
Actions.playlist_save: save the playlist in a file.
Actions.prelisten_options: Show a context menu with the prelisten player options
Actions.prelisten_output: Set this deck to be used for the prelisten player Example: "deck 1 prelisten_output", or to put it back to default: "prelisten_output 'auto'"
Actions.prelisten_pos: move the position of the prelisten player
Actions.pulse: return true when the previous action turns to true only for the duration specified: 'is_using 'equalizer' & pulse 2000ms'
Actions.quantize_loop: when quantize_loop is on, loops automatically align according to the globalQuantize setting
Actions.quantize_setcue: when quantize_setcue is on, setting cues automatically align according to the globalQuantize setting
Actions.quick_filter: Apply or remove a quick filter on the list of song shown in the browser
Actions.rack: Open/close a unit in specified rack. Example: "rack 'rack1' 'unit1'"
Actions.rack_prioritize: Prioritizes a unit of the specified rack. When more configurations with same size are available, the prioritized unit will get most space. Example: "rack_prioritize 'rack1' 'unit1'"
Actions.rack_solo: Open/close a unit in full size on the specified rack. Closing the unit will re-open the previous configuration. Example: "rack_solo 'rack1' 'unit1'"
Actions.rane_motor_enable: Sent from controller to software to indicate hardware state of motor. While off, the controller ignores motor commands
Actions.rane_timecode: Activate timecode from the timecode input with the same index as the controller it's called from and deactivate timecode inputs from the same input on other decks
