Actions.rane_timecode_enable: Set timecode mode for this deck to midi-controlled play-state
Actions.rating: Get or set the rating for the current song
Actions.reanalyze: reanalyze bpm etc... for the file loaded on the deck 'reanalyze multi' can be used to scan for multiple bpm's
Actions.record_cut: cut the current recording to a new file (or new track if recording to CD)
Actions.record_vu: show the volume of what's being recorded
Actions.recurse_folder: display the content of both the selected folder and all its subfolders in the browser list.
Actions.refresh_controller: refresh the display of the specified controller (or all if none specified).
Actions.reinit_controller: Reinit the specified controller (or all if none specified), going through the exit and init sequences (you can specify a delay between exit and init: "reinit_controllers 'mycontroller' 200ms".
Actions.relay_play: Enable or disable the decks to automatically start playing when the opposite deck reached its end
Actions.reloop_exit: if in loop, remove the loop. otherwise, reactivate the last used loop. Highlights when a loop had been used
Actions.repeat: repeat the actions every x ms as long as the key is pressed: 'repeat 1000ms & browser_scroll +1' (default is 500ms if no speed is specified. Second parameter can specify a delay before repeating the first time)
Actions.repeat_song: When active, song will restart from beginning when finished
Actions.repeat_start: Repeat an action at a specified interval: 'repeat_start 'myrepeatname' 1000ms 5 & browser_scroll +1' (first parameter is an identifier name, second parameter is the interval and the third optional parameter can specify a number of times to repeat). The first action will be performed after an interval has passed. The interval can be specified in milliseconds, beats, or can be an action of itself. 'repeat_start 'myrepeatname' 1bt' or 'repeat_start 'myrepeatname `get_var a`'
Actions.repeat_start_instant: Repeat an action at a specified interval: 'repeat_start_instant 'myrepeatname' 1000ms 5 & browser_scroll +1' (first parameter is an identifier name, second parameter is the interval and the third optional parameter can specify a number of times to repeat). The first action will be performed immediately.
Actions.repeat_stop: stop a previous repeat_start or repeat_start_instant action: 'repeat_stop 'myrepeatname''
Actions.rightcross: assign this deck to the right of the crossfader: "deck 3 rightcross"
Actions.rightdeck: select this deck to be the right deck: "deck 3 rightdeck" or "rightdeck +1"
Actions.rightvideo: assign this deck to the right of the video crossfader: "deck 3 rightvideo" or "rightvideo +1" or "rightvideo 'auto'".
Actions.rightvideo_button: simple button to control the right video source: "deck 3 rightvideo_button".
Actions.sampler_abort_rec: cancel the recording and delete the sample file
Actions.sampler_assign: 'sampler_assign 1 "path to vdjsample"' adds the sample to sample slot 1. (For use in drag&drop in pad page)
Actions.sampler_bank: Select a new sampler bank. Can be called either by name (sampler_bank "birthday"), by number (sampler_bank 2) or can be assigned to a rotary knob (sampler_bank) or buttons (sampler_bank +1)
Actions.sampler_color: get the color of the sample on this slot if it has one The sample number takes the sampler_pad_page into account, so should be used in combination with sampler_pad
Actions.sampler_edit: edit the given sample in the SampleEditor
Actions.sampler_group_color: get the color of a sampler group
Actions.sampler_group_mute: mute/unmute a sample group. You can specify the group by name, or by group index
Actions.sampler_group_name: get the name of a sampler group
Actions.sampler_group_volume: change the volume of all the samples in the give group. You can specify the group by name, or by group index
Actions.sampler_has_group: returns true if the specified group (specified by name or by index) exists in the current samplebank
Actions.sampler_inputgain: set the gain of the hardware sampler input
Actions.sampler_load_to_deck: Load the sample from the selected slot to the deck
Actions.sampler_loaded: 'sampler_loaded 1' returns true when there is a sample loaded in slot 1, otherwise returns false
Actions.sampler_loop: use 'sampler_loop -1' or 'sampler_loop +1' to change the length of a playing sample use 'sampler_loop "current" 1' to set the sample to loop for 1 beat or 'sampler_loop 1 1' to set sample 1 to 1 beat loop use 'sampler_loop "current" 0.5 "play" while_pressed' to loop the sample as long as long as the button is pressed for 0.5 beats
Actions.sampler_mode: set the global trigger mode for the sampler: "sampler_mode 'on/off'", 'hold', 'stutter' or 'unmute' set trigger mode for a specific sample: "sampler_mode 1 'on/off'" to set sample 1 mode or "sampler_mode 1 +1" to cycle
Actions.sampler_options: popup the sample menu. can also be used with 'sampler_options "locked"' or 'sampler_options "stemswap"' to change the bank's settings.
Actions.sampler_output: Select sampler output channel. 'deck master sampler_output', 'sampler_output "headphones"', 'deck 1 sampler_output', 'sampler_output "popup"'
Actions.sampler_pad: 'sampler_pad 1' triggers the sample in slot 1, based on the play mode for that sample slot
Actions.sampler_pad_page: show next page of samples if the bank has more than 8 samples
Actions.sampler_pad_shift: 'sampler_pad_shift 1' stop sample when playing, delete sample otherwise
Actions.sampler_pad_volume: 'sampler_pad_volume 1' sets the volume of the sample on the first pad 'sampler_pad_volume "siren"' sets the volume of the sample 'siren.vdjsample'.
Actions.sampler_pfl: Select if the sampler is sent to the headphones. (can be used with a slider or a % to specify the volume: 'sampler_pfl 75%')
Actions.sampler_play: play the selected sample. syntax 'sampler_play' plays the default sample. 'sampler_play 4' plays the fourth sample.
Actions.sampler_play_stop: play the selected sample if it's not already playing, or stop it if it's already playing.
Actions.sampler_play_stutter: play the selected sample. if already playing, restart from begining.
Actions.sampler_position: get the current position of the sample
Actions.sampler_rec: On first press, start to record a new sample. On second press, stop to record Use 'sampler_rec "mic"' to record a sample from microphone, or 'sampler_rec "master"' to record from master output If the deck is on loop, a loop sample will immediately be created. If the deck is playing, it will record what's playing until the stop. If the deck is paused, it sets the 'entry point', and the second push will set the 'exit point' and use the deck's file between those two points. 'sampler_rec 1' or 'sampler_rec 1 "mic"' will store the sample in the first slot of the "Record" sample bank, so that it can be used immediately after recording
Actions.sampler_rec_delete: delete a recording from the "Recordings" bank "sampler_rec_delete 3" would delete the sample previously recorded using "sampler_rec 3"
Actions.sampler_select: select which sample is the default sampler slot for that deck. syntax 'sampler select 5' selects the fifth sampler slot. 'sampler select +1' scrolls through the sampler slots. 'sampler select' open a popup menu to select the new default sampler slot.
Actions.sampler_start_rec: start to record (from the deck, or from mic or master if specified) in order to create a new sample file
Actions.sampler_stop: stop the selected sample. syntax 'sampler_stop' stops the default sample. 'sampler_stop 4' stops the fourth sampler slot. 'sampler_stop all' stops all samples.
Actions.sampler_stop_rec: stop the recording and save the result in a sample file
Actions.sampler_used: check if a sample is playing (or if used with 'sampler_used 4' check if exactly 4 samples are playing)
Actions.sampler_volume: 'sampler_volume' sets the volume of the sample that has the focus, on the selected deck. 'sampler_volume 1' sets the volume of the sample in slot 1 in the current bank. 'sampler_volume "siren"' sets the volume of the sample 'siren.vdjsample'.
Actions.sampler_volume_master: 'sampler_volume_master' sets the master volume of the sampler
Actions.sampler_volume_nogroup: sets the volume of the sample without changing the volume of other samples in the same group
Actions.sandbox: activate/deactivate sandbox mode. in sandbox mode, the master output continues to play what it was playing without being affected by your actions, and you can move both decks to whatever position you want, in order to prelisten your upcomming mix.
Actions.save_config: save your config changes now (usually changes are saved automatically when you close virtualdj)
Actions.save_deck_set: Save the current configuration (which song is loaded on which deck) in a file
Actions.saved_loop: 'saved_loop 1' Load the saved loop in slot 1 or set if it doesn't exist 'saved_loop "myloop"' Load saved loop named "myloop" or set if it doesn't exist
Actions.saved_loop_autotrigger: 'saved_loop_autotrigger 1' Activate/Deactivate auto-trigger of loop when the play position arrives at the saved loop
Actions.saved_loop_display: Show information about a saved loop based on the savedLoopDisplay config option. Example: 'saved_loop_display 1' Can also be used to modify the savedLoopDisplay option by using +1 or -1 as parameter: 'saved_loop_display +1'
Actions.saved_loop_prepare: 'saved_loop_prepare 1' Activate/Deactivate the saved loop in slot 1 without jumping to the start point or set if it doesn't exist 'saved_loop_prepare "myloop"' Activate/Deactivate stored loop named "myloop" without jumping to the start point or set if it doesn't exist
Actions.scratch_dna: execute a scratch defined by its DNA signature (see scratch_dna_editor for information about DNA signatures)
Actions.scratch_dna_editor: open a visual editor to compose scratch DNA signatures
Actions.scratch_dna_option: set some options about the Scratch DNA behavior. options are "drymix" and "quantized"
Actions.scratchbank_unload: Unload the song previously loaded using scratchbank_load_to_deck from deck and load back the last song
Actions.search: put the keyboard focus on the search zone, or, if a text parameter is specified, search for this text.
Actions.search_add: add the specified text to the search query
Actions.search_delete: remove the last character from the search query
Actions.search_folder: open a dialog to search for folders or playlists by name
Actions.search_options: popup the list of search options. to set one directly, you can use 'search_options "composer"' to toggle search of the field on or off
Actions.search_playlists: open a dialog to search which list contains a specific song by default it searches for the song selected in the browser. Use "search_playlists deck" to search for the song loaded on the deck.
Actions.seek: move into the song while the button is pressed. 'seek +2' moves beat by beat, skipping 2 beats every 10ms. 'seek +420ms' moves from 420ms every 10ms. using skip with a beat number keep the song playing correctly while moving inside.
Actions.select: select this deck as 'working deck'. the beat of the working deck will be shown in front in the display, and shortcuts and actions with no specified deck will affect this deck.\nUnless PFL has been set manually, the PFL will also follow the working deck.
Actions.select_master_output: Select if the audio should be played on the computer speakers or on the controller audio output
Actions.set: set 'varname' 5 sets variable varname to the value 5 set 'varname' 'var2' sets variable varname to the value of variable var2 set 'varname' `play` sets variable varname to the value of the action play
Actions.set_bpm: set the bpm of the song to the set value: 'set_bpm 129.3', or relative to the actual value: 'set_bpm 50%'.
Actions.set_browsed_file_bpm: set the bpm of the selected songs to the set value: 'set_bpm 129.3', or relative to the actual value: 'set_bpm 50%'
Actions.set_cue: store the current position in the cue. if one parameter is given, it's the number of the cue to use. if two parameters are given, the second is the position to store, in ms, in beats, or in percentage of the song length.
Actions.set_deck: use script or implicit variable to affect which deck the action is applied to example: 'set_deck `get_var varname` & play'
Actions.set_firstbeat: moves the first beat to the current position, adjusting the beat-grid
Actions.set_gain: set the gain in order to bring the song to the specified dBA (with 0dBA being the maximum level outputable by the soundcard without compression): 'set_gain 0'
Actions.set_key: change the key of the song to match the given key. you can use standard notation ('set_key "A#m"') or numeric ('set key "03A"'). if no given key, it will use the other deck. the change will match the exact key.
Actions.set_loadpoint: Set the point where the track will start when loaded
Actions.set_mixpoint: Move the specified mix point to the current position ("StartTempo", "EndTempo", "StartCut", "EndCut", "StartFade", "EndFade", "StartSound", "EndSound") Example: set_mixpoint "StartTempo"
Actions.set_var: set the value of the specified variable
Actions.set_var_dialog: set_var_dialog 'varname' opens a dialog to enter the value of varname set_var_dialog 'varname' 'information text' opens a dialog to enter the value of varname, and shows the second parameter as informational text
Actions.setting: read or write a specific setting (see config window for the list of all settings names) Example: setting "jogSensitivityScratch" 80% Example: setting "videoRandomTransition" on
Actions.setting_reset: reset a setting to its default value
Actions.setting_setdefault: change the default value for a setting during this session
Actions.setting_setsession: force a specific value for a setting during this session
Actions.setting_setsession_deck: force a specific value for a setting during this session for a specific deck
Actions.shift: set or query the built-in shift variable, used for controllers
Actions.shift_all_cues: shift all the cues of the song from the given amount (can be used to fix the cues from v7 imported files in case the automatic fix didn't work properly): 'shift_all_cues -10ms'
Actions.show_pluginpage: show or hide the plugin control windows in the browser area
Actions.show_splitpanel: Show/hide the specified split panel Examples: "show_splitpanel 'sidelist'", "show_splitpanel 'sideview' on", "show_splitpanel 'sidelist' 50%"
Actions.show_text: Show text on controller display. (If your controller uses get_display for the displays) "show_text 'Line 1|Line 2' 3000ms" will show 2 lines of text for 3 seconds (time optional, | separates lines) "show_text '$myvar$'" shows the contents of the variable $myvar
Actions.show_window: on skin with multiple windows, show or hide the specified window
Actions.sidelist_add: Add the songs selected in the browser to the sidelist
Actions.sidelist_load: Load the folder or playlist selected in the browser in the sidelist Use "sidelist_load 'append'" to add the selected folder to the sidelist instead of replacing the existing sidelist
Actions.sidelist_load_and_keep: load the first song from the sidelist.
Actions.sidelist_load_and_remove: load the first song from the sidelist, and remove it from the sidelist.
Actions.sidelist_options: display a drop-down with the list of options for the sidelist.
Actions.sidereco_options: Show a menu to select what should be displayed in the sideview recommendation panel
Actions.sideview: Show a specific folder in the sideview. Available sideviews are automix,sidelist,karaoke,sampler,clone Use 'sideview +1' or 'sideview -1' to scroll between available sideviews
Actions.sideview_options: show the context menu to add or remove folders shortcuts to the sideView
Actions.sideview_sort: Sort the sideview on the specified column: 'sideview_sort "artist"', 'sideview_sort "lastplay"',...
Actions.sideview_title: Show the title of the folder selected in sideview
Actions.sideview_triggerpad: set the sideview sampler in triggerpad mode or in list mode
Actions.silent_cue: Mute track when enabled until a hot cue is activated
Actions.skin_panel: show or hide a panel on the skin. "skin_panel 'my_panel' on"
Actions.skin_panelgroup: change which panel from a skin panel group is shown. syntax "skin_panelgroup 'groupname' 'panelname'" or "skin_panelgroup 'groupname' +1" or "skin_panelgroup 'groupname' 0.75"
Actions.skin_panelgroup_available: set a panel to be available or not. panels that are not available will not show up in group cycles
Actions.slicer: "slicer 1" to "slicer 8" for 8 slicer buttons "slicer 1 'hold'" to hold the current position on first activate "slicer 'length' +1" to increase length "slicer 'step' +1" to increase step size "slicer video" to toggle video slicer on or off
Actions.slip: activate or deactivate a global slip mode, that will save the position on "slip on" and resume where it should have been if untouched on "slip off", letting you do any scratch/loop/effect/etc in between
Actions.slip_mode: While in slip mode, during loops hotcues or scratch, the play cursor will keep moving unaffected, and will resume from there after release
Actions.smart_cue: when smart_cue is on, songs are automatically re-synchronized when jumped to a new position or cue
Actions.smart_fader: When smart fader is activated, songs are synchronized while using the crossfader, and the tempo moves toward the tempo of the song that is being faded into
Actions.smart_loop: when smart_loop is on, loop are automatically adjusted to sound perfect
Actions.smart_play: when smart_play is on, songs are automatically synchronized when started
Actions.smart_scratch: when smart_scratch is on, backward scratching is automatically muted, only forward scratching will be heard
Actions.song_pos: position in the song. (the difference between song_pos and goto is that song_pos can be used as a slider).
Actions.songpos_remain: get the remaining time in %. if used with a parameter (in % or ms), returns true if the time left is less or equal than the value: 'songpos_remain 500ms ? blink'.
Actions.songpos_warning: returns true if the song is in its last 30s (actual time can be adjusted in options)
Actions.speedwheel: used for a precision touchwheel that reports both position and speed. 'speedwheel +1.0 1.5' means a full rotation of the wheel, at 150% speed.
Actions.startupspeed: vinyl startup speed, the larger, the longer it takes for the record to get from stopped to playing
Actions.stem: Change the amount of a stem in the mix. Stem names are: "HiHat", "Vocal", "Instru", "Bass", "Kick", or you can use aggregate stems: "Melody" (Instru+Bass), "Rhythm" (HiHat+Kick), "MeloVocal" (Melody/Vocal), "MeloRhythm" (Melody/Rhythm). To get kill on left side and isolate on right side of the slider, you can use "FullVocal", "FullMelo" and "FullRhythm" To map a slider to always control the equalizer, regardless of EQ mode, you can use "stem FreqHi", "stem FreqMid", and "stem FreqLo"
Actions.stem_color: get the default color of a specific stem
Actions.stem_pad: mute a stem (or isolate if pressed with Shift). Stem names are: "HiHat", "Vocal", "Instru", "Bass", "Kick", "Rhythm", "MeloRhythm", "Acapella", "Instrumental"
Actions.stem_volume: change the amount of a stem in the mix. Stem names are: "HiHat", "Vocal", "Instru", "Bass", "Kick", or you can use aggregate stems: "Melody" (Instru+Bass), "Rhythm" (HiHat+Kick), "MeloVocal" (Melody/Vocal). stem_volume has the max volume at 100% for use on sliders, whereas stem has defaults at 50%, and isolates above 50% for use on knobs
Actions.stems_bleed: Control how much the fast stems separation algorithm will allow bleeding. The action affects one of the four bleeding values (MuteVocal, MuteInstru, OnlyVocal, OnlyInstru) depending on what is currently muted or isolated on the deck. (NOTE: this does nothing on the regular HiQuality algorithm)
Actions.stems_split: 'stems_split' will duplicate deck 1 to deck 3 or deck 2 to 4, with the vocals playing on the first deck and the instruments on the other deck 'stems_split vocal target' will duplicate the opposite deck to the deck stems_split was called from
Actions.stems_split_unlink: After using stems_split, you can use stems_split_unlink to have the decks behave independently, allowing to scratch the vocals without affecting the instrumental for example
Actions.stop: stop to the last cue point, then on second press to the beginning of the song, then cycle through the cue points.
Actions.stop_button: depending on the play_mode, act like pause_stop (Numark way) or stop (Pioneer way).
Actions.switch_sidelist_playlist: Exchange the content of the automix list and the sidelist
Actions.sync: smoothly synchronize the song with the other deck.
Actions.sync_hint: sync_hint 'pitch' returns true if the pitch should be matched. Then sync_hint 'phase' returns true if the phase should be synced
Actions.system_volume: Change the system volume of the active sound card when available (use has_system_volume to check)
Actions.timecode_active: Select if the deck is controlled by a timecode signal. (note: You can use 'timecode_active x' where x is the turntable number, to assign the same turntable to control several decks at once: 'deck 1 timecode_active 1 on & deck 2 timecode_active 1 on')
Actions.timecode_bypass: Use the timecode turntable as linein input
Actions.timecode_cd_mode: Force timecode to CD mode (use when using a vinyl timecode on a cd or other digital device)
Actions.timecode_motor_enable: Hybrid turntables that send midi messages to indicate if motor is enabled can use this
Actions.timecode_pitch: For controllers that send the pitch through midi, let the timecode engine know the pitch slider's position
Actions.timecode_reset_pitch: Reset the "software" pitch to 100%, so that the deck pitch matches the turntable pitch exactly, and needle-drop is truly absolute
Actions.toggle: syntax: 'toggle "my_var"'. toggle my_var between true and false.
Actions.touchwheel: used for a jogwheel with touch sensitivity. 'touchwheel +1.0' means a full rotation of the wheel.
Actions.touchwheel_touch: use when the touchwheel is touched, to hold the song and start to scratch.
Actions.undo_load: Unload the song and reload the previous song. Use 'undo_load any' to unload from the last deck a song was loaded on. Otherwise the deck the action is called from is used.
Actions.unload: unload the song from the deck.
Actions.up: execute different actions depending if the key if pressed or released: 'up ? action1 : action2'
Actions.var: 'var "my_var" ? my_action1 : my_action2'. execute my_action1 if my_var is true (non zero), execute my_action2 otherwise. You can also compare var with a specific value: 'var "my_var" 1 ? my_action1 : my_action2' execute my_action1 is my_var is 1, or my_action2 otherwise
Actions.var_equal: syntax: 'var_equal "my_var" 42 ? my_action1 : my_action2'. execute my_action1 if my_var equals 42, execute my_action2 otherwise. syntax: 'var_equal "this_var" "that_var" ? action1 : action2' execute action1 if this_var equals that_var, execute action2 otherwise
Actions.var_greater: syntax: 'var_greater "my_var" 42 ? my_action1 : my_action2'. execute my_action1 if my_var is greater than 42, execute my_action2 otherwise.
Actions.var_list: show a window with a list of your current variables and their values
Actions.var_not_equal: syntax: 'var_not_equal "my_var" 42 ? my_action1 : my_action2'. execute my_action1 if my_var doesn't equal 42, execute my_action2 otherwise.
Actions.var_smaller: syntax: 'var_smaller "my_var" 42 ? my_action1 : my_action2'. execute my_action1 if my_var is smaller than 42, execute my_action2 otherwise.
Actions.video: open or close the video window
Actions.video_crossfader_auto: move the video crossfader automatically according to which side is playing, cueing, scratching, etc...
Actions.video_crossfader_link: link or unlink the video crossfader to the audio crossfader
Actions.video_delay: set a delay between video or audio to synchronize output (in milliseconds) Use "video_delay +100ms" or "video_delay -100ms" to increase or decrease the delay, or "video_delay 0ms" to reset it Use "video_delay +100" or "video_delay -100" to set it to exactly the specified amount
Actions.video_fx_button: push the n-th button of the video effect plugin
Actions.video_fx_clear: deactivate all the active video effects
Actions.video_fx_select: select a video effect plugin. you can specify by name ('video_fx_select "my_plugin"'), relative ('video_fx_select +1') or without parameters to open a popup window listing the available plugins
Actions.video_fx_slider: move the n-th slider of the video effect plugin
Actions.video_level: fade-to-black independent slider for the left or right video deck
Actions.video_output: Show menu to select on which monitor to open the video output. You can also specify a specific output: "video_output 1" to open video output on the first monitor To just show or hide the output use "video_output on" or "video_output off". To toggle output, use "video_output ? video_output off : video_output on"
Actions.video_source: activate video if not active yet, and open the shader selection dialog if shader is the source
Actions.video_source_select: select the plugin used for video source. you can specify by name ('video_source_select "webcam"'), relative ('video_source_select +1') or without parameters to open a popup window listing the available plugins
Actions.video_transition: Launch a transition from one video deck to the other. You can specify the duration of the transition: 'video_transition 1000ms' You can specify the direction of the transition: 'video_transition "left"' or 'video_transition "left" 1000ms' You can specify the location to transition to using a percentage (or assign it to a slider): 'video_transition 50%' or 'video_transition 1000ms 50%'
Actions.video_transition_button: push the n-th button of the video transition plugin
Actions.video_transition_select: select the plugin used for video transitions. you can specify by name ('video_transition_select "my_plugin"'), relative ('video_transition_select +1') or without parameters to open a popup window listing the available plugins
Actions.video_transition_slider: move the n-th slider of the video transition plugin
Actions.view_options: popup the list of view options. to set one directly, you can use 'view_options "showkaraoke" on' etc...
Actions.vinyl_mode: Set the jogwheel to Vinyl mode (with scratch), or to CD mode (with pitchbend)
Actions.wait: wait for the specified amount of time between two script actions: 'wait 1bt & pause', 'wait 500ms & play'
Actions.wheel_mode: change the mode of the jogwheel between: "jog", "search", "loop_move", "loop_out", "loop_in", "browser", or use +1 and -1 to cycle through all modes. You can select from a subset using a syntax like 'wheel_mode "loop_move,loop_in,loop_out" +1'.
Actions.zoom: zoom horizontal rhythm and scratch visual

Config.InVirtualdjYouCanChoose:
In VirtualDJ you can choose the direction of loops, when using loop for x beats.

The traditional way is ahead, where you set your loop-in point, and hope the coming part of the song is what you want to loop, and that it will sound good.

Loop-Back mode instead loops what you just heard, where you set the loop-end point and it instantly jumps back and loops those x beats

Config.SandboxIsAFeatureThat: Sandbox is a feature that lets you 'try' transitions in your headphones, in advance, while the current song is playing to the audience.\n\nWhen sandbox is activated, the currently playing song will continue to play undisturbed on the master output, but you will be able to play with both decks to fast-forward, rewind, crossfade, etc and all these actions will affect only what you hear in your headphones
Config.SandboxShouldBeActivatedWhile: (sandbox should be activated while you have a single deck playing)

Config.ShowSongsOnTheDrive: Show songs on the drive, but not in any playlist
Config.ShowTracksLinkedToThe: Show tracks linked to the playing song
Config.SmartKeyMatchOnlyApplies: Smart Key Match only applies if the key change is within +1/-1 semitone.\nIf you want to adjust the key more than this, you can select it from the drop down menu manually

Config.TheseEmptyButtonsAreFor:
These empty buttons are for you to customize!

VirtualDJ is used by hundreds of millions of DJs all around the world, from beginners to super stars, in bedrooms, radios, clubs, festivals.
That's a lot of different people, with a lot of different needs.
And we know that your needs are different and unique too.
That's why we left a few "empty" customizable buttons and knobs, so you can customize VirtualDJ to fit your exact needs

Config.VirtualdjCanAutomaticallyExtractThe: VirtualDJ can automatically extract the different stems\nfrom the tracks you want to save on your USB drive.\nStems will appear as separate tracks on the CDJs
Config.VirtualdjHasDetectedAnInstability: VirtualDJ has detected an instability in your video drivers,\nand switched to a less aggressive video acceleration.\nWe recommend to restart VirtualDJ now
Config.VirtualdjIntegratesNativelyWithSeveral: VirtualDJ integrates natively with several online catalogs of songs, videos and karaoke
Config.VirtualdjIsFreeToUse: VirtualDJ is FREE to use for personal use, using a mouse and keyboard.\nBut if you want to use it with some professional DJ equipment, you need to get a license
Config.VirtualdjIsFreeToUse2: VirtualDJ is FREE to use for personal use, using a mouse and keyboard.\nBut if you want to use it with some professional DJ equipment, you need to get VirtualDJ PRO
Config.VirtualdjIsInDemoMode:
VirtualDJ is in "Demo Mode".

When in Demo Mode, VirtualDJ restart and reset
all its parameters every 5 minutes
Config.VirtualdjIsUsedByHundreds:
VirtualDJ is used by hundreds of millions of DJs all around the world, from beginners to super stars, in bedrooms, radios, clubs, festivals.
That's a lot of different people, with a lot of different needs.
And we know that your needs are different and unique too.
That's why we left a few "empty" customizable buttons and knobs, so you can customize VirtualDJ to fit your exact needs.

Have you ever wished that VirtualDJ had a button for this or a button for that?
With hundreds of actions available in the VDJScript language, we're sure you'll find what you need.
Reverse? master tempo? start/stop podcast? change sampler bank? It's all there.
You could even assign several effects parameters to the same knob to create cool effects
Config.VirtualdjRemoteLetsYouScratch: VirtualDJ Remote lets you scratch, mix and control VirtualDJ from your mobile device\nwirelessly while the computer is plugged to your sound system. The VirtualDJ Remote application\ngives you full freedom to operate VirtualDJ over a WIFI connection
Config.VirtualdjUsesVideoSkinsTo: VirtualDJ uses video skins to overlay on your video output.\nIf you want to disable it, open the INTERFACE page in settings\nand select none in the videoskins list at the bottom
Config.VirtualdjWasUnableToOpen: VirtualDJ was unable to open your settings file. Check the VirtualDJ permissions in System Preferences, Security & Privacy, Privacy Tab, Files and Folders and ensure VirtualDJ has access to your Documents folder. Then restart VirtualDJ to load your settings
Config.VirtualdjWasUnableToStore:
VirtualDJ was unable to store your license.
Check the VirtualDJ permissions in System Preferences, Security & Privacy, Privacy Tab, Files and Folders
and ensure VirtualDJ has access to your Documents folder.
Then restart VirtualDJ and log in again
Config.WaitingForSoundToBegin: Waiting for sound to begin recording..

Config.WarningFramesDroppedTryLowering2: Warning: Frames dropped, try lowering recordVideoResolution

Config.WeCanLetYouUse2: We can let you use it for free for a while, but you need to connect to the Internet
Config.WithoutAHighEndGraphic: Without a high-end graphic card we do not recommend calculating high-quality stems in real-time, because maxing out your computer's resources during live performances can affect heat, battery life & overall stability
Config.WithoutALicenseYouCan: Without a license, you can use a controller only for 10mn at a time

Config.WithoutALicenseYouCan3: Without a license, you can use an analog mixer only for 10mn at a time

Config.WithoutASubscriptionYouWill3: Without a subscription, you will be able to play only a short extract from this song
