Settings.analyzeSongsOnView: When enabled, unscanned files are automatically scanned as they are browsed
Settings.askTheDJFrequency: Frequency (in seconds) at which to update AskTheDJ
Settings.askTheDJMonitoring: Choose if AskTheDJ keeps polling requests when the folder is not shown
Settings.audioAutoDetect: Keep checking for new devices to detect when a known soundcard is plugged in
Settings.autoBPMMatch: Automatically change the pitch to match the BPM of the other deck when a new song is loaded ("smart" means only when the song's bpm is within 10% of the other deck's song)
Settings.autoBpmTransitionLength: Length of transition done by auto_bpm_transition in beats
Settings.autoCue: Automatically goes to the first cue or first beat when a song is loaded
Settings.autoDiscMarker: Automatically put the disc marker back to 0 degrees on cue points
Settings.autoGain: Automatically set the gain to make the song's overall volume 0dbA when a song is loaded (or remember any previous manual modification of the gain)
Settings.autoHeadphones: Automatically switch the headphones and selected deck to the song that has just been loaded or touched
Settings.autoKey: Automatically change the key when a song is loaded to match the key of the song on the other deck when the key difference is up to 1 semitone
Settings.automaticDatabaseBackupPeriod: Number of days between each automatic database backup, or 0 for no automatic backup
Settings.automixAutoRemovePlayed: Files will be removed from the automix playlist when they get played during automix, or when they get played any time
Settings.autoMixBeatMatchOnFade: When automix mode is set to fade and songs tempo is close to each other, they will be beatmatched
Settings.automixDoubleClick: While automix is active, select what happens when double-clicking a song
Settings.automixDualDeck: Use both decks and the crossfader to perform the automix, instead of doing everything on a single deck
Settings.automixMaxLength: Maximum time (in seconds) a song will play in automix before skipping to the next song
Settings.automixMode: Force the automix engine to use one particular mode
Settings.automixRepeat: The automix playlist will repeat from the beginning when it reaches the end
Settings.automixSkipLength: Number of beats to fade when forcing automix to skip to a different song (double-click or mix_now for example)
Settings.automixTempoMode: When automix mixes to the next song, it can either go back to 0% pitch, keep the pitch the same, or keep the bpm the same (when possible within a pitch of +-10%)
Settings.autoPitchLock: Automatically engages pitch_lock whenever BPMs are matched, so that moving manually one pitch slider will move the other in order to keep the match
Settings.autoPitchRange: Automatically adjust the range of the pitch when pitch-matching requires a broader range
Settings.autoRefreshDRM: Automatically refresh the DRM of your online catalogs downloaded song when they're near expiration
Settings.autoSearchDB: Automatically add any song that VirtualDJ encounters while browsing your folders and drives, to the search database
Settings.autoSideview: Switch sideview to sampler when sampler_bank action is used to change sample bank
Settings.beatCounterRange: Set over how many beats the beat counter on the skin is counting (default: 16)
Settings.beatjump: Number of beats the beatjump script will jump
Settings.boothMicrophone: The microphone input is also heard on the booth audio output
Settings.broadcastDirectFormat: File format used to broadcast ("ogg" is better quality but works only in Chrome, "mp3" works with any browser)
Settings.broadcastDirectMaxClients: Maximum number of listener who can connect to your computer at the same time in Direct Broadcast (don't put too high if you don't have a lot of bandwidth)
Settings.broadcastDirectPort: Internet port used for direct broadcast
Settings.broadcastDirectQuality: Encoding quality (compression) when using Direct Broadcast
Settings.broadcastMode: Broadcast mode ("direct" if you want to stream directly from your computer, "server" if you want to stream to a radio station, "podcast" if you want to save your podcast on virtualdj.com for later use)
Settings.broadcastSongInfo: Set to no if you don't want your listeners to see the titles of what you are playing
Settings.broadcastSongInfoFormat: Set how the title is formatted that is sent to the broadcast server
Settings.broadcastVideoKey: stream keys for the video broadcast
Settings.broadcastVideoQuality: Amount of compression used when broadcasting video (the lower the quality the bigger the compression)
Settings.broadcastVideoQualityCustom: Custom video broadcast quality "resX x resY @ videokbps , audiokbps"
Settings.broadcastVideoURL: url of the video broadcast servers
Settings.browserAutoExportM3U: Automatically save a .m3u copy in %AppData%/VirtualDJ/Playlists/ for each list in MyLists (in case you use an external utility that reads only m3u format)
Settings.browserAutoOpenNewDrive: Automatically select a new external drive or usb key when plugged in
Settings.browserAutoZoom: Automatically zoom the browser on mouse-over
Settings.browserBPMDigits: How many digits after the dot should be displayed in the browser when showing a BPM
Settings.browserColumns: Columns displayed in the various browser windows
Settings.browserDaysSongsAreNew: Number of days after first seen a file that it gets the new file icon
Settings.browserFontSizeButtons: Show buttons on the browser toolbar to fine tune the font size, instead of the quick big/small button
Settings.browserGridColumns: Columns displayed in the various browser windows while in grid view
Settings.browserPadding: Padding around lines in the browser
Settings.browserPreviousFoldersButton: Show a button on the browser toolbar to go back to previous folders
Settings.browserSearchByFirstLetter: When the focus is on the browser, typing on the keyboard will select the song starting with this letter, instead of using the keyboard mapper
Settings.browserShortcuts: Quick shortcuts to folders to display on the left toolbar
Settings.browserShortcutsCustomIconFile: If you want to use your own icon collection, select an image with a grid of 64x64 icons
Settings.browserShortcutsDefaultIcon: Default icon number used when adding a new shortcut. -1 to popup the list.
Settings.browserShowLegacyM3UPlaylists: Show the old .m3u playlists to keep working with them (in case you use an external utility that also modifies them)
Settings.browserShowSideviewInLists: Show the sideview's automix, sidelist and karaoke lists in the MyLists folder
Settings.browserSort: Sort column used in the various browser windows
Settings.browserTextFit: How to display large text in the browser when it's too long to fit
Settings.cdjExportAutoSyncCues: Automatically keep the cue points synchronized when modified inside VirtualDJ and on a CDJ
Settings.cdjExportCompatibility: Minimum level of compatibility for CDJ flash drive databases
Settings.cdjExportCuesAsMemoryPoints: Store cue points as memory points as well on cdj export
Settings.cdjExportShowAllDrives: Show all USB drives under the CDJ Export folder
Settings.cdjExportStems: List of stems combinations to export on CDJ flash drive when exporting a new file
Settings.cdjExportStemsConfig: List of possible combinations of stems to export on CDJ flash drives
Settings.chartsCountry: Force the charts to show results from another country than where you are currently located
Settings.checkUpdates: What to do when there is a new version of VirtualDJ available
Settings.cleanTagsInDeckDisplay: title, artist, featuring and remix are uniformly formatted for display in the deck's tag info display
Settings.cleartype: Use ClearType to show sharper text on laptops
Settings.cloudDriveEngine: Select the storage engine that will be used by CloudDrive
Settings.cloudDriveFullAccess: Get full access to browse the full content of your storage engine
Settings.cloudDrivePauseSync: Let you pause all CloudDrive synchronization (if you need to preserve your internet bandwidth)
Settings.cloudDriveSync: keep track of the folders you synced to CloudDrive
Settings.cloudDriveSynchronization: Select two-way if you are modifying the clouddrive on another computer and want the changes to be reflected on this computer
Settings.coloredWaveforms: Select which color scheme is used on the waveforms to identify the beat, vocal and instrumental areas
Settings.colorPicker: Select which colorPicker to use. 'auto' uses gradient in tag editor and simple otherwise
Settings.controllerRefreshRate: Maximum refresh rate of MIDI/HID controllers (in ms between refresh). 0 means as fast as possible, which is refresh every 10ms (100 times per seconds).
Settings.controllerTakeoverMode: Defines how sliders and knob are behaving when the value on the controller doesn't match the value on the skin: "Instant" means as soon as you touch the slider on the controller, VirtualDJ will use the controller's position. "Pickup" means that the controller's slider has no effect until it reaches the current skin's position, at which point both positions become linked again. "Gradual" means that when you move the controller's slider, it will moves the skin's slider in the same direction to gradually match both positions
Settings.controllerTakeoverModePitch: Defines how the pitch slider on the controller is behaving when it doesn't match the software pitch value: "Instant" means as soon as you touch the slider on the controller, VirtualDJ will use the controller's position. "Pickup" means that the controller's slider has no effect until it reaches the current pitch, at which point both pitch become linked again. "Gradual" means that when you move the controller's slider, it will moves the software's pitch in the same direction to gradually match both positions, "Relative" means that when you move the controller's slider, it will move the software's pitch in the same direction and same amount.
Settings.controllerWaveFormZoom: Zoom level for certain controllers with a waveform display
Settings.coverDownload: Automatically download cover pictures when a new file without cover is encountered
Settings.coverFlow: Select how to display the cover pictures on the coverflow band
Settings.cpuMeter: Show in the CPU meter how fast the whole system is running, or how fast the audio subsystem is running.
Settings.crashGuard: CrashGuard constantly monitors the VirtualDJ process, and silently reboot it without interruption if something goes wrong
Settings.crashReportLevel: If you experience some problems and the technical support ask you to submit more detailed dump files, set this to the value the technical support agent told you
Settings.createMidiLog: When on, will create a log file for your MIDI controller, that can be used by our engineers to find problems or help write native support.
Settings.crossfaderCustom: Save a custom configuration for the crossfader
Settings.crossfaderHamster: Invert the crossfader (so that putting the crossfader to the left-most position makes the right deck audible and the left deck silenced)
Settings.cueDisplay: Select what is shown on hotcue buttons
Settings.cueLoopAutoSync: When on, cue_loop will be quantized to the beat
Settings.cueMode: Select if the cue button act as cue, cue-hold (will keep playing if cue is pressed more than 2s), or cue-cup (play on release, stop and rewind on push)
Settings.customButtons: Actions saved for the various custom buttons and custom knobs
Settings.dateFormat: Select how dates are shown in the browser
Settings.dialogsColorTheme: Force the dialogs and menus to use a light-color or dark-color theme
Settings.disableBuiltInDefinitions: Set to yes if you don't want VirtualDJ to use its built-in controller list to recognize MIDI or HID devices
Settings.disableDuplicateForNewLists: Set all new Lists to "no Duplicates" by default
Settings.disableHotplugForNewLists: Set all new Lists to "disable Hotplug", which will keep the list on the main drive instead of splitting it across the various drives where the content is
Settings.displayTime: Select the way song time is displayed (elapsed, remain, total)
Settings.dontLogin: Set to yes if you don't want to log in (and see the log in window when you start VirtualDJ)
Settings.dontShowAgain: Dialogs that you asked not to show again
Settings.earlyAccessUpdates: Get early access to new updates and new features as soon as they are fully tested
Settings.effects: remember the plugins loaded on the deck slots
Settings.endOfSongWarning: Time left in song (in seconds) when to show the end-of-song warning
Settings.eqMode: Select which algorithm the EQ knobs control
Settings.eqModeDual: Use extra decks on 4-deck mixers to control both frequency and modern EQs at the same time
Settings.equalizerFrequencySpread: Defines the spread of the equalizer bands. "Default" has each band narrow around their frequency, while "Full Kill" has each band extending to share its border with the next band (meaning if you kill all 3 bands in "Full Kill" mode, you'll get silence, while if you kill all 3 bands in "Default" mode, you'll get everything except the bass, medium and high bands)
Settings.equalizerHighFrequency: Set the central frequency used by the High equalizer
Settings.equalizerInHeadphones: Set to yes (default) if you want to hear the equalizer on the PFL, or no if you want to hear the original song
Settings.equalizerLowFrequency: Set the central frequency used by the Low equalizer
Settings.equalizerMidFrequency: Set the central frequency used by the Mid equalizer
Settings.exclusiveAudioAccess: When set to yes, VirtualDJ will take exclusive control of your soundcard, meaning that all other applications running in the background will stop to make any sound while VirtualDJ is active
Settings.fadeLength: Length (in seconds) of the transition when using "fade" automix. Negative length adds delay between songs
Settings.faderCurve: Set the curve for the volume sliders (0=linear, 0.5=quadratic, 1=logarithmic)
Settings.faderStart: Automatically starts to play when the volume fader is moved up
Settings.faderStartStop: Automatically stops to play when the volume fader is moved down to zero (requires faderStart to be enabled as well)
Settings.favoriteGenres: List of genres to be offered first when editing the genre field
Settings.favoriteTags1: List of tags to be offered first when editing the user1 field
Settings.favoriteTags2: List of tags to be offered first when editing the user2 field
Settings.fileFormats: List of extensions that will be displayed in the browser
Settings.filterDefaultResonance: Set the amount of resonance applied by the filter
Settings.filterFolderSplitGenreBySlash: When enabled, a slash is seperating genres in filter folders
Settings.fontSize: Font size modifier for the browser
Settings.fxProcessing: Select if effects are processed before or after level fader and crossfader (pre-fader or post-fader)
Settings.fxStyle: Style of the native audio effects
Settings.gainSliderIncludesAutoGain: when set to yes, the gain knob on the skin shows at 100% when the gain is equal to the automatic value. When set to no, 100% on the knobs means no gain applied.
Settings.getCommentFromTags: Get the comment field from the tag
Settings.getCuesFromTags: Get the cues field from the tag
Settings.getRatingFromTags: Get the rating field from the tag
Settings.getRemixWhenParsingFilenames: Get the remix field when filename are formated like "artist - title (remix)" or "artist - title [remix]"
Settings.getTagFromZip: Open zip files to see if there is a mp3 or mp4 file inside to get tags from
Settings.getTagsAuto: Automatically get infos from the file's tags when a new file is encountered
Settings.getTitleFromTags: Get the title and artist fields from the tag
Settings.globalQuantize: Select 1 to make quantized functions jump to beat boundaries, 4 to jump to measures boundaries, or 0.25 to jump on quarters boundaries.
Settings.gridView: Display the lists of files as a grid instead of row by row
Settings.headphonesGain: Set the gain applied to the headphones output
Settings.hideSongInfo: Hide the song's title and artist from the skin, if you don't want people behind you to be able to see which tracks you are playing
Settings.historyDelay: Number of seconds a song needs to be playing before it's considered 'played' and added to the history, tracklisting, etc (default: 45 seconds)
Settings.hotcueMode: Select if hotcue buttons play or stutter
Settings.hotcueSavesLoop: When a hot cue is saved while a loop is active, the loop will be saved with the hot cue
Settings.ignoreDrives: List of drives to ignore when looking for VirtualDJ databases
Settings.importV7Databases: Automatically import databases from VirtualDJ 7.x or earlier into the new VirtualDJ 8.x format if needed
Settings.infoviewColumns: Fields displayed in the info side-panel
Settings.internetProxyPassword: Password of proxy to access internet (if required)
Settings.internetProxyPort: Port of proxy to access internet
Settings.internetProxyURL: URL of proxy to access internet
Settings.internetProxyUsername: Username of proxy to access internet (if required)
Settings.iRemote: Look for old v7 remote application
Settings.iRemoteDefaultPort: Port on which to connect with old v7 remote clients
Settings.iRemoteList: list of old v7 remote clients
Settings.iTunesDatabaseFile: Path to your iTunes database file
Settings.jogSensitivityBend: Set the sensitivity of the controllers jogwheels when pitch-bending
Settings.jogSensitivityCue: Set the sensitivity of the controllers jogwheels when cueing
Settings.jogSensitivityScratch: Set the sensitivity of the controllers jogwheels when scratching
Settings.jogVibrationProtection: If the track is moving on it's own while paused, increase this value to prevent it (Leave on 0 unless there are issues)
Settings.karaokeAutoRemovePlayed: Remove played tracks automatically when in karaoke mode
Settings.karaokeBackgroundImage: Select which image will be displayed when the background music is playing and karaokeBackground is set to image (between karaoke songs)
Settings.karaokeBackgroundMusic: Select which folder is used to play background music between karaoke song, when the karaoke mode is active. (can also be "automix" (default) or "sidelist", to respectively use the automix playlist or the sidelist playlist from the sideView)
Settings.karaokeBackgroundVolume: Set the volume at which the background music is played, between karaoke songs
Settings.karaokeDualDeck: When enabled, play karaoke on one deck and background music on another deck. Otherwise karaoke and background music play on the same deck
Settings.karaokeSkipSilence: Automatically skip silence at end of karaoke song when playing background music in karaoke mode
Settings.karaokeVideoSkin: Select video skin to be used while karaoke is active
Settings.keepBPMonAnalyzerUpdate: When enabled, automatically detected bpm and beat-grid will not be updated when the bpm analyzer has been updated. Only manual re-scan will then update the bpm and phase with the new analyzer.
Settings.keepPlayingPastEnd: When on, the song keeps playing after the end and you have to press cue manually to stop the song
Settings.keepPlayStatusOnLoadSong: When on, a new song loaded to the deck will start playing automatically if the previous song in the deck was playing
Settings.keepSortOrder: Keep the sort order when you change folder
Settings.keyboardKeymapOverlayOnStickyKeys: While sticky keys is on (double-press ALT, or key assigned to keyboard_shortcuts) the keyboard mapping overlay will stay visible
Settings.keyboardShowKeymapOverlay: While holding CTRL or ALT, show keyboard mapping overlay in browser area on supported mappers
Settings.keyDisplay: Show keys on deck and browser either in Musical format (C, C#, D, etc...) or Harmonic (01A, 02A, 01B, ...)
Settings.keyMatching: Standard allows automatic key matching to change the key by one semi-tone, in order to harmonically match to the other song. Fuzzy will also allow changes from major to minor key, and fuzzy full will allow changing the track up to 2 semi-tones to harmonically match the other track
Settings.lastSelectedFolder: Last selected folder (saved for the next session)
Settings.lastTrackListDate: Last date from the tracklisting.txt file
Settings.letterBoxing: Select how to handle the difference in aspect ratio between your video files and your video output window
Settings.levelfaderHamster: Invert the fader (so that it is fully on when down and fully off when up)
Settings.liveFeedback: Show new track recommendation based on the feedback of millions of other DJs who have played the same tracks as you just did
Settings.liveFeedbackUseBpm: LiveFeedback should prioritize recommendations with a similar BPM (turn it off if you play cocktails or weddings where BPM is not important)
Settings.loadSecurity: Ask a confirmation message if you try to load a song on a deck that is already playing. Silent will not load and not show a confirmation dialog.
Settings.lockFolderOrder: When active, the order of folders is locked and can't be moved accidentally by dragging them around
Settings.logUnsuccessfulSearches: Automatically save all unsuccessful searches into the file SearchLog.txt
Settings.loopAutoMove: Select if the loop is kept and moved to the new position when a cue is called during a loop
Settings.loopBackMode: Select, when a loop is set by number of beats ('loop 4'), if the loop starts from the current position (no) or ends at the current position (yes). Smart means set start when paused or set end when playing.
Settings.loopDefault: Default number of beats used in loops
Settings.loopPadPage: Loop pad page currently selected on each deck
Settings.loopRollDefault: Default number of beats used in loopRolls
Settings.masterEffects: remember the plugins loaded on the master effect slots
Settings.masterTempo: Make the pitch slider changes the speed of the song, but not its key
Settings.maximized: Select if the skin is maximized to use the full desktop (1), use the full desktop including the taskbar (2), or windowed (0)
Settings.maxPreloadLength: Prevent overloading your memory, by not fully preloading any song that is longer than this value (in minutes). Set to -1 to always preload. 0 to select automatically
Settings.maxStemLength: Prevent overloading your memory, by not fully preloading stems for any song that is longer than this value (in minutes). Set to -1 to always try to allocate memory for stems
Settings.metronomeVolume: Set the volume used by the metronome ticks in the BPM Editor
Settings.microphoneToMaster: The microphone input is heard on the master audio output (when false, microphone will be included in recording, but not heard on master output)
Settings.mixerOrder: For 4-deck controllers, defines the order of the decks from left to right
Settings.mixFx: The last selected mix effect when using the crossfader
Settings.motorWheelInstantPlay: On controllers with motorized jogwheel, when you press play, the song will play instantly at its normal speed, even if the motor takes some time to reach its nominal speed
Settings.motorWheelInstantStop: On controllers with motorized jogwheel, when you press pause, the song will stop, even if the motor takes some time to slow down
Settings.motorWheelLockTime: Set the number of seconds that VirtualDJ stops to interpret the motorized jogwheel movements after a play or stop action is done (to prevent the wobbling movement of the motor when it abruptly stops)
Settings.motorWheelSmoothPercent: Helps smoothing the motorized jogwheel speed against fluctuations due to the OS delays in receiving the MIDI or HID messages
Settings.multiTouchTwoFingerScroll: Enable scrolling with two fingers on touch-screens
Settings.netsearchAudioQuality: Quality (and size) of the audio files that online audio catalogs will download. Note that not all quality levels are offered by all providers
Settings.netsearchVideoQuality: Quality (and size) of the video files that online video catalogs will download
Settings.nonColoredPoi: Specify how to choose the default color for CUEs and other POIs that don't have a specific color
Settings.OnlineCatalogs: Specify which catalog(s) to use for online search
Settings.OnlineCatalogsWhenEmpty: Only search online catalogs if no local result was found
Settings.onScreenKeyboard: Show an on-screen keyboard when you need to edit something
Settings.os2l: Send beats and bpm to any DMX software compatible with OS2L (Open Sound To Light protocol)
Settings.os2lBeatOffset: Apply a correction (in milliseconds) to the time beats are send to os2l, to correct sync issues
Settings.os2lDirectIp: Set the IP and port of your DMX application to connect OS2L directly without using Bonjour or Zeroconf
Settings.padsPagesChanged: Pads Pages modified from the controller defaults
Settings.padsPagesHidden: List of pages hidden from the page selection drop-down
Settings.padsSkinIndependent: Set to true to keep the pads on the skin independent from the controllers
Settings.pflOnSelect: Automatically switch the PFL when a deck is selected
Settings.pitchQuality: Choose which algorithm to use when pitching/scratching/mastertempo. 1 is fastest, 2 is good quality, 3 is excellent quality, 4 is best quality but requires fast cpu
Settings.pitchRange: Set how far the pitch slider can move
Settings.pitchResetSpeed: How fast pitch reset moves the pitch (in percent per second, default 1 percent per second)
Settings.playMode: Select if the play and stop buttons act as play-stutter and pause-stop, or play-pause and stop
Settings.poiEditorShowAll: Show system POIs in the POI Editor
Settings.poiEditorSnap: Snap POIs to the beat in the POI Editor
Settings.prelistenOutput: Selects which deck is used to output the prelisten sound (from the editors or the info panel preview). 0 means automatically select the deck that is not currently on air
Settings.prelistenStartPos: -1=default, 0 to 1: start at that location in the song
Settings.prelistenStopOnChange: Stop the prelisten if it was playing when you switch to a new file in the browser
Settings.prelistenVisible: Show the prelisten control in the info panel
Settings.quantizeLoop: Automatically adjust the loop position to the quantized position
Settings.quantizeScratch: Keep the song synchronized by quantizing after releasing the jog wheel
Settings.quantizeSetCue: Automatically adjust setting cue position to the quantized position
Settings.rampScratchTime: Simulate how a real turntable needs time to react when the disc is touched
Settings.rampStartTime: Simulate how a real turntable needs time to reach its full speed when started
Settings.rampStopTime: Simulate how a real turntable brakes to reach full stop when stopped
Settings.readOnly: Set VirtualDJ in read-only mode, the databases on the drives will not be modified
Settings.recordAutoSplit: A new recorded file will be created each time you move the crossfader from one side to another
Settings.recordAutoStart: The recording will automatically start as soon as you press play on a deck
Settings.recordBitDepth: 24-bit only available for wav and flac. Warning: 24-bit files are not compatible with all media players!
Settings.recordFile: File use to record the mix
Settings.recordFormat: File format used to record the mix (mp3, ogg, flac, wav, webm, mp4)
Settings.recordMicrophone: When set to no the microphone is not recorded or broadcasted
Settings.recordOverwrite: Decide what to do when you record a new file (and didn't manually change the output filename)
Settings.recordPauseOnSilence: When a long silence is detected during recording, the recording will pause. After sound is detected again, recording will resume, but the silence will be excluded from the recording
Settings.recordQuality: Amount of compression used when saving the recording (the lower the quality the bigger the compression)
Settings.recordVideoCodec: Video Codec used when recording video. Note that h265 and av1 are not available on all hardware
Settings.recordVideoFps: Frames per seconds for video recording. Note that to record at 60fps, videoFps also needs to be set to 60
Settings.recordWaitForSound: Once recording is started, the recording will wait until something is actually playing before recording
Settings.recordWriteCueFile: A .cue file will be created alongside the recorded mp3, with the times and titles of each track you play (the .cue file can be used by many CD burning software to create tracked CDs)
Settings.rememberRecurse: Remember if recurse was used on a folder
Settings.removePlayedFromSidelist: When you play a song long enough to mark it as played, and the song was in the sidelist, remove it from the sidelist
Settings.resetEqOnLoad: Automatically reset all the equalizers and filter to 0 when you load a new song
Settings.resetFXOnLoad: Automatically stop all the effects when you load a new song
Settings.resetGainOnLoad: Reset gain and apply autoGain when enabled when you load a new song. This option has no effect when a controller that applies gain in hardware is used
Settings.resetKeyOnLoad: Reset key to normal when you load a new song.
Settings.resetPitchOnLoad: Automatically reset the pitch to +0% when you load a new song
Settings.resetStemsOnLoad: Automatically reset the stems when you load a new song
Settings.rhythmZoom: Zoom level of the horizontal rhythm and scratch display
Settings.rootFoldersLocation: List of root folders that will be displayed in the tree view
Settings.RPM: Rotation speed of the domes on the skin (default: 33)
Settings.safeVideoDecode: Use this if your are experiencing troubles with old video drivers using hardware decoding of videos
Settings.samplerApplyEffectsOnDeckOutput: When samplerOutputDeck is set to a fixed deck and this setting is turned on, deck effects, equalizer and filter are also applied to the sampler. Otherwise only volume and pfl affect sampler.
Settings.sampleRate: Force the internal samplerate. If set to "auto" VirtualDJ will use the samplerate recommended by your soundcard. If you are playing a lot of MP3 files, we recommend using a 44100 samplerate. If you are playing a lot of VOB videos, we recommend using 48000. As a rule, a bigger samplerate DOES NOT mean a better sound quality, on the opposite. The best quality is when your source file, internal samplerate, and soundcard, all use the same value. And since you can change the value of the soundcard and of VirtualDJ, but not of the source files, you should set the value that matches most of your files (mp3 are 44100, videos are 48000)
Settings.samplerBank: Name of the sample bank that is currently loaded
Settings.samplerDefaultLoopMode: Set the default sync mode that is used when a new loop is recorded.
Settings.samplerDontSaveSource: When set to yes, new samples that are recorded will not save their source file filepath (if you want to distribute the sample file without exposing your folder paths)
Settings.samplerExportLossless: When set to yes, new samples that are recorded will be saved using a lossless algorithm (FLAC). When set to false (default), they will be slightly compressed using OGG.
Settings.samplerForceNbColumns: Force a layout for the sample pad in the sideView
Settings.samplerHeadphones: Sampler can be heard in headphones
Settings.samplerHideDefaultBanks: Let you hide the default banks
Settings.samplerHideLegacyBanks: Hide the old legacy banks from VirtualDJ v8 if they're still in the folder
Settings.samplerImageSize: Specifies the size of the image on a sampler pad
Settings.samplerIndependentDeckBanks: Each deck and master can have their own sample bank
Settings.samplerOutputDeck: Where to route the output from samples in non-stemSwap banks (or triggered from sideview sampler). 0 for master/all decks, -2 for trigger deck, -1 for headphones, 1 for deck 1, 2 for deck 2, etc...
Settings.samplerRecordLength: When recording a stem slot on the pads, record for the duration specified
Settings.samplerRecordStemsPads: Select which pads will record which stems for stemsSwap banks
Settings.samplerRootFolder: Let you change the default folder where the samples are stored
Settings.samplerShowEffects: Show effect toolbar in sampler sideview
Settings.samplerShowWaveform: Show sample waveforms in the sampler sideview
Settings.samplerSpanAcrossDecks: When set to yes, if a bank with 16 samples is loaded, deck 2 will automatically show the second half (9-16)
Settings.samplerTriggerMode: Defines how the sampler slots are triggered: "on/off" means the sample starts when you press once, and stop when it reaches the end of the sample or when you press again. "hold" means the sample starts when you press, and stops when you release the pad. "stutter" means the sample starts when you press, and continue until the end of the sample. If you press the pad again, it restarts the sample from the beginning. "unmute" means the sample keeps running in the background, but is audible only while the pad is pressed.
Settings.samplerVideoVolumeLink: Video samples fade to black with sample volume when on
Settings.sandboxPreviewOnly: In preview only sandbox mode, only the song position is reflected in the sandbox. volumes, crossfaders, equalizers and effects are still applied to the main output
Settings.sandboxSplitHeadphones: In sandbox mode, sends the sandbox master to the left ear of your headphones, and the sandbox pfl to the right ear
Settings.savedLoopDisplay: Select what is shown on the saved loop buttons
Settings.savePlaylist: Automatically save the automix/sidelist/karaoke list between sessions
Settings.saveUnplayedToSidelist: When you load a song on a deck, but change your mind and don't play it and load something else, automatically put the song in the sidelist for later
Settings.scratchFilterQuality: Choose the quality of the algorithm used for the scratching. Higher values increase sound quality but also increase cpu usage. Default is 12, maximum is 32
Settings.scratchZoomVertical: Zoom level of the vertical scratch display
Settings.searchFields: Fields used by the search engine
Settings.searchInDB: Search results display all results from the database
Settings.searchInFolder: Search results display results from the current folder first
Settings.searchInOnlineCatalogs: Search results display results from online catalogs if an Internet connection is available
Settings.sendAnonymousStats: Help improve VirtualDJ by sending anonymous statistics about which controller you use, which skin, etc
Settings.sendHistory: Save your playlists on your virtualdj.com account (some features won't be available if you disable this)
Settings.seratoFolder: Path to your Serato crates folder
Settings.setTagsAuto: Automatically write infos to the file's tags when something is modified inside VirtualDJ
Settings.shellIcons: Display the real OS icons instead of the VirtualDJ flat one, for regular folders
Settings.shopDemoMode: In Shop Demo Mode, VirtualDJ cannot be closed, and all the settings will be automatically reset every 5 minutes
Settings.showControllersSubDevices: Show display and main device as separate controllers on certain devices for development purposes
Settings.showCoverForDragDrop: show the cover of the files being dragged during drag-and-drop operations
Settings.showGridLines: Show grid lines on the scratch and rhythm waves
Settings.showHorizontalSideList: Show the horizontal sidelist like in older VirtualDJ versions
Settings.showKaraoke: Activate filter to show only Karaoke tracks
Settings.showM3UAsFolders: When opening a folder, check if it has .m3u playlist files inside, and if so show them as subfolders
Settings.showMusic: Activate filter to show only Audio tracks
Settings.showTipOfTheDay: show Tip Of The Day when new ones are available
Settings.showVideo: Activate filter to show only Video tracks
Settings.showVideoSkinOnPreview: Show the video skin on the video preview on the main skin
Settings.showZipKaraoke: When browsing the content of a folder, check for all .zip files to see if it's a karaoke file (.mp3 + .cdg) inside
Settings.sideView: Save the sideview view between sessions
Settings.sideViewReco: Set the mode of the sideview recommendation panel
Settings.sideviewShortcuts: List of the folders that have shortcut buttons in the sideview
Settings.sideViewShortcutsHidden: List of default sideview buttons that are hidden
Settings.sixteenPadsMode: When on auto, 16-pads mode is enabled only when a controller with 16 pads is connected.
Settings.skin: Name of the current skin file
Settings.skin3FxLayout: Switch between "1 FX with 3 knobs" and "3 FX with 1 knob each" layouts
Settings.skin6FxLayout: Switch to "6 FX with 1 knob" layout
Settings.skinEmptyButtons: Show or hide some extra empty customizable buttons on the default skins
Settings.skinFPS: Set the number of frames per seconds the skin is updated. A higher value will make animation smoother, a lower value will make cpu usage lower
Settings.skinOverviewType: Set the waveform type for the overview display in decks ('auto' follows the main waveform type)
Settings.skinPlayheadShadow: Set whether songpos waveform shows the shadow on the playhead marker
Settings.skinUseLowPowerGPU: For laptop with dual-GPU, select if the skin and video should use the internal low-power GPU (to preserve battery) or the discrete high-power GPU. The low-power GPU is usually enough to draw the skin and for basic video mixing, and will make your battery last longer. Use the high-power GPU if you're doing complicated video mixing with complex effects or shaders.
Settings.skinWaveformScratchType: Set the waveform type for vertical scratch waves
Settings.skinWaveformType: Set waveform type in skins that support it
Settings.smartCue: Automatically adjust the jump position to keep the song beatmatched
Settings.smartLoop: Automatically adjust the loop points when setting a loop so that the loop is seamless
Settings.smartPlay: Automatically start playing from the nearest position that would get the song beatmatched
Settings.smartPlayLimitPitchRange: When on, smartPlay will only match bpm if it is within 10% of the current bpm, preventing too big speed differences
Settings.smartScratch: Automatically mute the volume when scratching backward
Settings.songLoadPriority: Lower song load priority to prevent audio drop-outs while loading
Settings.splitHeadphones: If set to true, the headphones will have the master in the left ear and the PFL in the right ear
Settings.startOfDayHour: Hour (in 24h format) at which to cut into a new date in tracklisting.txt (default: 8 AM)
Settings.startVideoOnLoad: Automatically open the video output window when you load a video track
Settings.stayLoggedIn: Set to no if you want VirtualDJ to ask your password everytime
Settings.stemsBleedMuteInstru: Control how much the "fast" stems separation algorithm will allow bleeding when muting instruments. 0% means strict separation (remove more instrument, but might remove other frequencies), 100% means less strict (might remove less instrument, but keep the original song more intact).
Settings.stemsBleedMuteVocal: Control how much the "fast" stems separation algorithm will allow bleeding when muting vocals. 0% means strict separation (remove more vocal, but might remove other frequencies), 100% means less strict (might remove less vocal, but keep the original song more intact).
Settings.stemsBleedOnlyInstru: Control how much the "fast" stems separation algorithm will allow bleeding when isolating instruments. 0% means strict separation (isolate better, but might remove some instrument frequencies too), 100% means less strict (might isolate less, but keep the instrument more intact).
Settings.stemsBleedOnlyVocal: Control how much the "fast" stems separation algorithm will allow bleeding when isolating vocals. 0% means strict separation (isolate better, but might remove some vocal frequencies too), 100% means less strict (might isolate less, but keep the vocal more intact).
Settings.stemsFix: If your computer is a little too old, try one of these options
Settings.stemsRealtimeSeparation:
- Always: separate every song when loading
- On-Demand: only separate songs that make use of stems (will have a small delay with reduced quality when starting)
- Prepared: offer to prepare saved stems when needed, and use reduced-quality in the meantime
- Reduced quality: silently use reduced quality if no prepared stems available
- Fully disabled: never try to separate stems, not even in reduced quality (modern waveforms will be unavailable)
Settings.stemsSavedFolder: By default prepared stems files are saved alongside their source file in the source file's folder. If you want all the prepared stems to be saved instead in a separate folder, set the folder here
Settings.stemsSavedStems: Choose if a prepared stems file should be saved automatically after a real-time separation
Settings.stemsSplitLeftRight: When enabled, stems_split will split from deck 1->2 and 3->4. When false, split from deck 1->3 and deck 2->4
Settings.timecodeAntiSkip: Prevent the song position to change if the needle slipped to the next or previous grooves (only for vinyl in smart mode). The value is how many grooves maximum the antiSkip will absorb.
Settings.timecodeCalibrationPhase: Calculated during calibration, this value checks if your input signal is stereo-inverted, and/or phase-inverted.
Settings.timecodeCalibrationVolume: Calculated during calibration, this value is the average volume of your input signal.
Settings.timecodeLeadInTime: Move the "start" of the timecode, to skip a section at the beginning of the record if it is damaged from too much use.
Settings.timecodeMode: Select what to do on needle-drop: relative=do nothing, absolute=use the offset from the beginning of the record, smart=use the distance if the jump is small, map the full length of the record to the full length of the song if the jump is bigger.
Settings.timecodeNeedleDropSync: When needle-dropping, wait to be sure of the new position before starting to play.
Settings.timecodePitchSliderIgnoreBend: The timecode pitch slider will not move during manual pitch-bend (braking or speeding up the record), but at the expense of a delayed movement of the slider if you make sudden big pitch modifications.
Settings.timecodeSilence: Level under which the timecode is considered stopped. Raise this value if you perform in a very noisy or vibration-full environment. Lower this value if you want to perform tricks that require very slow scratches.
Settings.timecodeType: Select which timecode type you are using (will be also set automatically during calibration, except for "VirtualDJ7 CD" which needs to be set manually).
Settings.tipOfTheDayAlreadySeen: list of Tip Of The Day already clicked or closed (that won't be shown again)
Settings.tooltipDelay: Delay during which the mouse must stop before the tooltip is shown
Settings.touchScreenMode: force a set of options usually used with touchscreens (gridview in the browser, maximized window, bigger handles on splitviews)
Settings.touchWheelBackspin: Moving a touchweel backward with the touch part pressed, and releasing it while the wheel is still spinning backward, will continue like if the wheel was still "touched" until the wheel stops moving, to produce a "backspin" effect
Settings.touchWheelForwardspin: Moving a touchweel forward with the touch part pressed, and releasing it while the wheel is still spinning forward, will continue like if the wheel was still "touched" until the wheel stops moving, to produce a "forward-spin" effect
Settings.touchWheelSpinThreshold: Minimum speed jogwheel needs to have on release before backspin or forwardspin will be triggered
Settings.tracklistFormat: format used when writing the tracklist.txt file (use the same syntax as the skin engine's text elements)
Settings.triggerPadView: Display the sampler as a pad in the sideview instead of as a list
Settings.ultraLatency: Set to yes to minimize the latency when using ASIO sound drivers, by writing audio before the "safe" recommended point. If you hear some cracks in ASIO, try to turn this off.
Settings.updateHotCueOnCueCombo: When a hot cue is pressed while holding the deck's CUE button, it will update the cue to the current cue position instead of jumping to the cue
Settings.useKeyFromTag: Prefer to use the key from the tag instead of the value calculated by VirtualDJ
Settings.useOpengl: Use openGL instead of Metal for graphic rendering
Settings.user1FieldName: Display name for the user-definable tags field
Settings.user2FieldName: Display name for the user-definable tags field
Settings.vdjRemoteDevices: List of mobile devices that will reconnect automatically if they're running VirtualDJRemote (v8 or above)
Settings.vdjRemoteIPs: List of manual IP addresses previously used for remote
Settings.VDJScriptGlobalVariables: List of persistent global variables saved by your scripts
Settings.videoAudioOnlyVisualisation: Select which visualization plugin will be used when a song with no video track is played and the video output is opened
Settings.videoCreateLinkOnDrop: Dropping a video on the video preview area or cover art of an audio file will automatically create a video edit of the audio file
Settings.videoCrossfader: Define the behavior of the video crossfader (Separate to control both audio and video separately, Linked to control both together, Smart to let VirtualDJ moves the video crossfader automatically to follow what the audience is hearing)
Settings.videoDelay: Set a delay (positive or negative) between the video output and the audio output (in milliseconds)
Settings.videoDriver: Show which video driver is being used by your computer
Settings.videoFPS: Set the number of Frame Per Seconds used by the video engine
Settings.videoFx: Select which video fx plugin is currently loaded
Settings.videoLogo: Show a logo on the bottom-right corner of the video output (you need a VirtualDJ PRO license to be able to remove or change the logo)
Settings.videoLogoImage: Select which image is used for the video logo (you need a VirtualDJ PRO license to be able to remove or change the logo)
Settings.videoLogoPosition: Select the position of the video logo (you need a VirtualDJ PRO or Controller license, or a Karaoke subscription to be able to change the logo position)
Settings.videoLogoSize: Select the size of the video logo (you need a VirtualDJ PRO license to be able to remove or change the logo)
Settings.videoMaxMemory: Enforce a hard limit on the amount of video memory from the video card VirtualDJ can consume
Settings.videoMicroFrames: Enhance the quality of the video at lower speed, by adding "MicroFrames" between the regular frames. When set to "smart", MicroFrames are used only when scratching or playing at low speed.
Settings.videoRandomTransition: Automatically select a new video transition plugin randomly for each transition
Settings.videoResampleQuality: Quality of the video when rescaling. High can look better, but may require a faster video card.
Settings.videoShaderQuality: Force visualization shaders to a lower quality, if your videocard is not powerful enough to keep up with the desired framerate
Settings.videoSkin: Name of the current video skin
Settings.videoTransition: Select which video transition plugin is used to fade between two video sources when the video crossfader is moving
Settings.videoUseDXVA: If set to true, the video engine will use Hardware Acceleration (DXVA) from your videocard, if available
Settings.videoVolumeLink: Moving the volume sliders automatically moves the video levels too
Settings.videoWindowAlwaysOnTop: Keeps the video window always above all other windows
Settings.vinylMode: In Vinyl mode, touching the disc on the skin or the jogwheel on a controller stop the song and scratch. In CD mode, it speed up or slow down a little the song.
Settings.vstFxFolder: Folder where your VST3 effects are installed. On Mac this is typically /Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/VST3 and on Windows C:\Program Files\Common Files\VST3
Settings.watchFolders: Comma-separated list of folders to automatically scan on startup to check for new files
Settings.waveGrayOnKill: Show in gray the stems that are removed on the shape waveform
Settings.waveUseFrequency: Use frequencies instead of stems to calculate the colors in the colors waveform
Settings.writeHistory: When disabled, don't log tracks in history and don't update play count or last play date
Settings.zeroDB: Add additional headroom to prevent distortion when mixing several tracks together by lowering the volume

skintooltips.AudioPanelShowTheEqualizers: AUDIO PANEL\nShow the equalizers and crossfader fx
skintooltips.AudioShowTheAudioMixer: AUDIO\nShow the audio (mixer) controls, like equalizers, gain, level, pfl, etc
skintooltips.BabyScratchDoASimple: BABY SCRATCH\nDo a simple scratch routine without crossfader cuts\nthat just slowly raises the amplitude of the scratches
skintooltips.BackspinDoASingleMovement: BACKSPIN\nDo a single movement scratch that imitates pulling a record backward
skintooltips.BeatgridClickOnceToTurn: BEATGRID\nClick once to turn on or off\nPress longer to turn on while pressed
skintooltips.BeatgridTheBeatgridEffectReorganizes: BEATGRID\nThe beatgrid effect reorganizes the beats following a preset pattern\nin order to instantly give some cool remix effect
skintooltips.BpmTheBpmBeatsPer:
BPM
The BPM (Beats Per Minute) value of a song shows how fast its tempo is
The faster the song, the higher the BPM value

An important part of DJing is to make sure that songs are at the same BPM when you mix them together
That's why DJs use the pitch slider to speed up or slow down songs in order to match their BPM
skintooltips.CrossfaderMenuShowSomeOptions: CROSSFADER MENU\nShow some options about the crossfader
skintooltips.CutApplyACutEffect:
CUT
Apply a cut effect to the sound
hashing the sound in bigger pieces as the effect goes stronger
Current [value]
skintooltips.DnaScratchTheScratchEffect: DNA SCRATCH\nThe scratch effect uses 'DNA' strings to encode cool scratch routines\nthat can be enacted with a simple click
skintooltips.FilterApplyAFilterEffect:
FILTER
Apply a filter effect to the sound
Turning the knob to the left will keep the bass
Turning the knob to the right will keep the high
Current [value]
skintooltips.FlangerApplyAFlangerEffect:
FLANGER
Apply a flanger effect to the sound
giving a trembling effect like the sound of a jet
Current [value]
skintooltips.FlaresScratchDoAScratch: FLARES SCRATCH\nDo a scratch routine that mixes simple scratches and crossfader cuts
skintooltips.JetScratchDoAScratch: JET SCRATCH\nDo a scratch routine that starts fast and ends up on longer cuts
skintooltips.JogwheelOptionsSelectWhatHappens: JOGWHEEL OPTIONS\nSelect what happens when you scratch on the disc

skintooltips.LoopRoll18RollALoop: LOOP ROLL 1/8\nRoll a loop over 1/8th of a beat
skintooltips.LoopRoll1RollALoop: LOOP ROLL 1\nRoll a loop over one beat
skintooltips.LoopRollTheLoopRoll: LOOP ROLL\nThe loop roll effect repeats a small snippet of the current track while pressed\nand jump back to the original position on release
skintooltips.MasterShowSomeGeneralControls: MASTER\nShow some general controls, like record/broadcast, microphone, or master effects
skintooltips.MixAssistLetVirtualdjDeal: MIX ASSIST\nLet VirtualDJ deal automatically with the beats synchronization\nso you can focus only on the artistic side of your mix

skintooltips.RecordToSampleRecordThe: RECORD TO SAMPLE\n Record the master output into a new sample file
